Mary Jane is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a selling sea foods business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more oyster to sell in her food stall.

Mary Jane has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: 09.01.8 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng has a retail business selling metals. She is requesting a loan to to purchase waste iron and metals to resell.

Hằng is 53 years old and married with 4 children. Hằng is the group leader of the 09.01.8 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown up.

In 2012, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hằng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her children to find a good job, her family to be healthy and happy, and her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase waste iron and metals to resell.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her raising pigs business.

Remegia has been in this business for 9 years. Remegia earns more income from general store.

Remegia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 43 years old and married with one child.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as soap, canned goods, milk, chips, eggs, spices, etc.

Lolita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and earns an income from pottery making.

Lolita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as soaps, canned goods, milk, chips, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Carmelita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Carmelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her transport business motorcycle.

Cristina has been in this business for 31 years. Cristina earns more income from food vending.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle used in her business.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en:
Mr. Terbish, 54 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2006. His wife has retired from work and gets state pension. His daughter has a position of manager in a private firm.

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years, so he decided to request loan of 3,000,000 MNT to renovate his house by purchasing building materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, and then release less pollutants into atmosphere. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam, to renovate his house.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and married with five children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as snack foods, noodles, sugar, soaps, shampoo and other groceries.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Myrna aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as snack foods, noodles, sugar, soaps, shampoos and other groceries.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor tiene 46 años y es casado con 4 hijos que tiene la edad de 21, 20, 17, 13 años, el Sr. Víctor se dedica a la confección de trajes (especialidad sacos) en su sastrería que se encuentra en la localidad de Batallas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Víctor va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de tela por rollo para la confección de sus prendas de vestir y algunos materiales que necesita para confeccion,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Víctor enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el de no contar con la maquinaria necesaria para la confección de sus prendas de vestir y con las ganancias seguirá comprando materiales y maquinaria para mejorar su taller de confección, el Sr. Víctor es una persona joven Emprendedora con gamas de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 46 and is married with four children who are 21, 20, 17, and 13 years old. Victor works making suits (especially jackets) in his tailor shop, which is located in the town of Batallas. 

This loan is his first cycle within the organization. Victor is going to use this loan to purchase fabric by the roll for making his garments and other materials that he needs for his work. His reason for requesting this loan is to increase his working capital. 

Victor faces some challenges in his business, including not having the necessary machinery for making his garments. With his earnings, he will continue purchasing materials and machinery to improve his shop. 

Victor is a young-at-heart, enterprising person with a desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life for his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase material, such as cloth, for tailoring.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Luningning works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing [from palm fronds]. Luningning is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to  buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Luningning has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en: Mr. Davaadorj, 33 years old, lives with his mother and step-father in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling casual clothes in an outdoor market for nine years. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy building and insulation materials in order to renovate his house. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a fisherman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of four children. Juan has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Juan needs a loan for his fishing business. He is asking for a loan worth 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.  

Juan dreams of expanding his business and making it a success and a stable source of his income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en: Mr. Batbileg, 34 years old, lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He had worked in Korea on an employment contract for eight years in a furniture factory. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in running a furniture factory during his time in Korea. Now he wants to run his own furniture factory in Mongolia using his experience from Korea. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 4500000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase equipment such as a paint gun, chain saw, nails and planks. As a result, he will successfully run his factory and can raise his living standard. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture factory equipment

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Regina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Regina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 68 years old and married with five children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell: shampoo, bread, juice and other groceries.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Yolanda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell: shampoo, bread, juice and other groceries

loans.name: Bara

texts.fr: Bara, âgée de 28 ans habite dans un quartier dont le nom signifie « la paix » et qui se trouve à environ   85km de la capitale. Bara est marié et père de famille. Il s’active dans le métier de carreleur et cela depuis 10 ans maintenant, mais seulement sept ans qu’il travaille pour son propre compte. Et des fois, il fait un peu de commerce. Il compte acheter des carreaux pour son exploitation. Avec les recettes de son activité, il pense pouvoir terminer la construction de sa maison, mettre un peu d’argent pour pouvoir réaliser un jour son vœu le plus cher qui est celui d’ouvrir un grand magasin, de créer des emplois et de devenir autonome dans son travail.
texts.en: Bara, 28, lives in a neighborhood whose name means “peace” and is located about 85 km from the capital. Bara is a married father. He is a tile layer and has been for ten years, though he’s been working for himself for the last seven. Sometimes, he also sells things. He plans to buy tiles to use. With the profits, he thinks he will be able to finish building his house and put aside a little money to be able to realize his dearest wish, which is to open a big store to create jobs and to become autonomous with his work.

loans.use: to buy tiles to use

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling gasoline. Vilma is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Gemma has been in this business for 12 years. Gemma earns more income from a general store.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell crabs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional crabs to sell for her buy-and-sell crabs business.

Helen has been in this business for 2 years. Helen earns more income from buy-and-sell young coconuts.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 45 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Delilah is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Delilah has been raising pigs for 18 years and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation and personal products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of purified drinking water to sell.

Doris has been in this business for five years. Doris earns more income from an internet cafe.

Doris has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Sukhtulga

texts.en: Mr. Sukhtulga, 42 years old, lives with his wife and children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He used to raise livestock in the countryside. Recently he has been employed as security officer by a private firm. His wife works as assistant cook in a restaurant. Their children go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house thus creating comfortable and warm accommodation for his family. Also his family will begin to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in preparation for incoming winter

loans.name: Altantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Altantulga, 37 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a driver in a steel mill for two years. His wife is unemployed and currently staying at home, looking after her children. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to renovate his house by buying necessary building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола родилась в 1981 года. Она вдова. Лола одна воспитывает и обеспечивает 3 сыновей, Часура, Холика и Абдурасула. Лола с детства помогала маме шить национальные тюбетейки, а также она помогла родителям выращивать сельхоз культуры. После смерти мужа она осталась без кормильца, и ей пришлось зарабатывать деньги. Она данное время занимается шитьём тюбетеек. Она оптом продает свою продукцию на местном рынке. Ее дети помогают ей введению бизнеса. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Она хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки нитки, ткани и т.п. для шитья тюбетеек. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Lola was born in 1981.  She is a widow who raises and supports her three sons (Chasur, Kholik and Abdurasul) by herself.  

Ever since she was a child, Lola has sewn traditional skull caps to help her mother and has been involved in crop farming with her parents.  After her husband's death, she was left alone to feed her children and had to find a way to earn some money.

Lola currently sews traditional skull caps and sells her production in bulk quantities at the local market.  Her children help her to run the business.  Lola also makes an additional income from animal husbandry.

Eager to increase her working capital, Lola is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy some threads, fabrics and so forth, to sew traditional skull caps.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads for her sewing business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 36 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and boarding-house rentals. Gloria is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell to her customers.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY  est une dame de 45 ans, qui s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 02 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle achète et vend des produits divers : de l’huile de palme, des oignons. Malgré son âge, elle fait aussi la navette entre le Sénégal et la Mauritanie pour chercher des produits comme du  savon, du lait, de la mayonnaise en pot, qui sont des produits qui se vendent pas chers là bas ; c’est d’ailleurs le but de son prêt. Elle n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent mais donne sa participation dans la gestion des besoins familiaux. Et travaille pour de meilleures conditions de vie de son foyer.
texts.en: Khady is a 45-year-old lady who has been in commerce for more than two years. She is a married mother. She buys and sells diverse products: palm oil, onions. Despite her age, she also shuttles between Senegal and Mauritania to find products like soap, milk, and jarred mayonnaise, which are products that aren’t expensive over there; this is the goal of her loan. She has nobody for whom she is responsible to burden her, but she participates in the management of family needs. She works for the best living conditions of her household.

loans.use: to buy tangerines, onions, soap, and jarred mayonnaise

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
Khadija is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been running a clothes stitching business of for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also deals in the work of clothing trade to generate extra income. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, Khadija requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, some stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers and laces. It will help her meet the demands of her customers on time.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

Khadija says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Elenita has been in this business for six years. Elenita earns more income from selling coconut and charcoal.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her business tricycle.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Kristine is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Kristine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Kristine requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Kristine has been in this business for five years. In the future, Kristine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 65 years old and married with nine children. Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, soft drinks and other beverages. 

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 64 years old and married with one child.

Benilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, juices, rice, canned goods, etc.

Benilda has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Benilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, juices, rice, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es:
Joel de 35 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta 3° grado. En casa convive con su madre pero ambos son independientes.

Joel es comerciante, tiene un puesto ambuelante de ventas varias, primero investiga un lugar especifico que estara de fiesta y viaja a dicho lugar, se establece y permanece el periodo que dura la fiesta(feria),  a veces esta hasta 3 semanas fuera de su casa. Antes era empleado, pero ya se independizo y tiene su propio negocio. Tiene 8 años de trabajar de esta manera y obtiene muy buenos resultados.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas, la que tiene esta en muy mal estado, tambien comprara una vaca para el padre, quien es ganadero, compra y vende ganado.

En el futuro, Joel espara tener el suficiente dinero para instalar un negocio fijo en la casa y asi armar su estructura de clientes, para no tener que irse de su casa y dejar sola a su madre.
texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old; he is single and doesn’t have any children. He stayed in school until the 3rd grade. He lives with his mother but they are both independent.

Joel is a businessman. He works making sales from place to place. First he looks for a specific location where a festival will take place, and he travels to that spot. He sets up and stays during the festival (fair); sometimes he will be away from home for 3 weeks. Before this, he was employed, but he went out on his own and now has his own business. He has been doing this work for 8 years, and he has excellent results.

The loan will be used to purchase a grill for making pupusas (stuffed tortillas); the one that he has is in very bad condition. He will also buy a cow for his father, who is a cattleman that buys and sells cattle.

In the future, Joel hopes to have enough money to set up a fixed business in his house, and in this way build up his client base, so that he doesn’t have to go away from home and leave his mother by herself.

loans.use: to purchase a grill for making pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and a cow.

loans.name: Almira

texts.ru: Алмире 18 лет. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная девушка. Алмира с ранних лет мечтала получить высшее образование и служить своей родине. С такой целью она отлично училась в средней школе. Алмира в этом году после окончания средней школы поступила в университет. Данное время она является студенткой 1 курса и она очень счастлива. Алмира запрашивает займ на сумму 350 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Almira is 18 years old.  She is a hardworking and ambitious young woman.  Ever since she was a child, she has dreamed of getting a higher education and to serve her country.  Keeping this goal in mind, she has done very well in high school and has just started university this year.  She is currently a first-year student and she is very happy.  She is requesting a loan of 350 USD to pay her university tuition.  She is relying on your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to finance her education.

loans.name: Mary Coney

texts.en:
Mary Coney is 41 years old and married with three children.

Mary Coney works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Coney has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns an income from farming rice.

Mary Coney aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for a year and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlita is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Merlita has a bakery business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.

Merlita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
This is Razia. She previously accessed a loan for her husband, which he used to buy spare parts and accessories, and pay for the maintenance of the rickshaw. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan for her husband to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the rickshaw. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain the daily needs of his family. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Razia hopes that this business will last longer. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can draw strength. 

All BRAC community clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community clients.

Razia says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the auto rickshaw

loans.name: Johann

texts.es: Johann de 23 años de edad,  desde hace 6 años tiene un negocio donde ofrece  servicios de internet, fotocopiajes, scanner, transcripciones y venta de minutos a celulares entre sus vecinos y transeúntes, que a diario circundan su negocio. Su meta es actualizar sus equipos y modernizar toda su infraestructura, para lograr muchos mas clientes. Ante este propósito, su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo, el cual por si solo, no responde a las expectativas de crecimiento que tiene Johann. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva,  mediante el cual comprará recargas telefónicas, papelería, tinta y 2 computadores. Con su credikiva inicia su sueño de modernización, que propone el aumento de su clientela y esto es mas ingresos y mejor nivel de vida, adicionandole que Johann trabaja 13 horas diarias de lunes a domingos para alcanzar sus pequeños y grandes retos.
texts.en:
For six years, Johann, 23, has been in business offering internet services, photocopying, scanning, transcriptions and the sale of cell phone call minutes to the neighbors and passersby who go past his business every day.  

His goal is to update his equipment and modernize his entire infrastructure so he can get a lot more customers.  To achieve this, the greatest challenge to him is his work capital, which on its own is not enough to fulfill the growth expectations that Johann has.  For this reason, he is asking for a Kiva loan, which he will use to buy phone recharges, stationery, printer ink and two computers.  With his loan he will kick start his dream of modernization, which will allow an increase in his customer base leading to more income and a better way of life.  

It must also be added that Johann works 13 hours a day, every day of the week, including weekends to achieve his goals, large and small.

loans.use: to buy cell phone recharges, stationery, printer ink and 2 computers.

loans.name: Laguna Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAGUNA AZUL”  iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde el señor Víctor es el Secretario. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, taller de costura, tienda de abarrotes, tienda de barrio, comerciante de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeños microempresarios donde el señor Víctor es integrante, el indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de taller de costura; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su pareja, ya que a ella lo conoció en un taller donde trabajaban los dos en esta actividad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su nuevo hogar pues recientemente empezaron a convivir.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, el responde que le gusta las reuniones, las capacitaciones en crédito y salud y los consultorios.
texts.en:
The "Laguna Azul" communal bank will enter its fourteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada regional office. It is made up of eight members and is headed by a board where Víctor is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the association perform are varied in nature, including the sale of clothes, a sewing workshop, a grocery store, a local store and the sale of artifacts.

The loan that they are taking out will help small micro-entrepreneurs such as Víctor who is a member and he says that it is the first time that he forms part of Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the communal bank. Currently he runs a sewing workshop which he started together with his partner as he got to know her in a workshop operating in this industry where the two worked together.

The loan that he will now take out is to increase their working capital (to buy fabric) that he will obtain from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto, to then sell on at customer orders. This manner of working allows him to generate an income to upkeep as much as possible the new home in which they recently started to live.

When asked what it is he likes about Pro Mujer, he responds that he likes the meetings, the training they receive in the loan and health, and the advice given.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Mariée à un mécanicien auto et âgée de 39ans, madame Akuvi pour aider son conjoint revend des charbons de bois et des céréales à domicile. Elle est à son troisième crédit à WAGES et ce montant l'aidera à acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle espère à l'avenir accroitre son activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Akuvi is married to a car mechanic and is 39 years old. In order to help her husband she sells charcoal and cereals from home. She is on her third loan from WAGES and this will help her to buy more goods so that she can satisfy customer demand. She hopes to expand her business in the future and to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and cereals.

loans.name: Kiyal

texts.ru: Кыял 41 год, разведена, одна воспитывает двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 2004 году, начала бизнес в торговле фруктами и овощами на центральном рынке города, в котором она проживает, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 2,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Кыял имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 14,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Кыял смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Кыял обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Кыял планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kiyal is 41 years old, divorced, and is raising two children alone (one son and one daughter). In 2004, she started her own business of selling fruits and vegetables at the central market in the city where she lives. She started this business with initial start-up capital in the amount of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work she put into her business, Kiyal has been able to increase her sales turnover and develop her business. For the purpose of further increasing and expanding her business, Kiyal turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her sales turnover. Kiyal plans to invest the earnings from the loan in sales turnover. She also intends to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Psychology and here is his story.
“I have always wanted to study at the American University of Central Asia. Because it has everything to learn, grow, develop, become independent, and be self-disciplined. The main value of education and that is why – my main reason and wish to be part of AUCA. Also, it is worth mentioning that there is modern, up to date equipment, and facilities needed for education. 
This university is the spirit of unity and freedom. Here all students are given an opportunity to express and discover themselves. The administration of the university pays great attention to the students social life, especially where vulnerable groups are given chances and opportunities. 
AUCA has many departments, but I chose Psychology Department. Because I would like to know more about the human mind, character, way of persons’ mind – human is the most mysterious creature. Even nowadays, 21st century when science and technology are well developed there still are possibilities of human mind, intellect are not discovered till the end. From my own experience there were some decisions or choices to do something I wanted. That is why I want to study at this department and not only develop and improve my personality, but I want to help and advise people. 
The last thing I want to mention is that during the 10 year anniversary “Debut”, where I was responsible for organization of the event, I met lots of AUCA graduates, and they all are well-respected everywhere because of high quality education. 
There is also another part of my story. I am not able to fully cover my tuition fees, but AUCA gives another unique opportunity to its students, which is a loan. The loan is given to all students applying for financial aid, which is supported through Kiva. I am very happy that AUCA cooperates with such a great organization that gives us students such opportunity.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Two years ago, Nuray opened an office after finishing her education in reflexology. When she first started. almost no customers came. Living in a small city, Nuray had to spend a very long time introducing herself and the work she did to the locals, but she didn't give up. 

After she separated from her husband, Nuray worked to establish a life for herself. She has an adult son who is studying at university. She says she will use the loan to buy pharmaceutical  products to make massage oils. Nuray has another dream for the future: opening her own home-cooking restaurant where she will work in the kitchen. Nuray says that she has struggled her whole life and after her son finishes university, she wants to live for herself, strong and determined.
 
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nuray  2  yıl  önce  aldığı  eğitim  sonucu  refleksoloji(ayak tabanından tedavi )üzerine bir iş yeri açmış.İlk  başlarda  nerdeyse  hiç  müşterisi  gelmemiş. Küçük  bir  şehirde  yaşayan  Nuray  şehir halkına  yaptığı  işi  ve  kendisini  tanıtmak  için  çok  uzun  zaman  harcamak  zorunda  kalmış  ama vazgecmemiş. Eşinden  ayrıldıktan  sonra  kendine  bir  hayat  kurmaya  calısan  Nuray   yetişkin  bir de  oğlu  var  ve  üniversitede  okuyor. Alacağı  krediyle  masaj  yağı  yapımında  kullanmak  üzere  ilaç alacağını  söylüyor  ve  ileriye  yönelik  bir  de  hayali  var ;kendisinin  de  mutfağında  çalışacağı  ev yemekleri  lokantası  açmak. Hayatı  boyunca  mÜcadele  içinde  olduğunu  ve  oğlu  üniversiteyi  bitirdikten sonra  kendisi  için  yaşamak  istediğini  belirten  Nuray  azimli  ve  güçlü bir  karakter.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products to make massage oils

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 47 years old, lives in a minority community in Kosovo and is a widowed mother of a 22 year old son. She works as a nurse and her son works as a musician. Things have been very difficult for Mila raising her son alone and providing for them both. They lived in a very old house and she has finally been able to get a new one for them to live in. 
  
After she was able to get her new home, she could not finish it completely, being unable to fix the the front of her house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to facade and finish her house . This loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her and her family as her goal is to give her son the best future and to save money for him. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To finish new home and fix the the front of her house

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилором работает продавщицей на центральном рынке города Турсунзаде. Она продает специи и приправы различного вида и всем по вкусу. Дилором любит свою работу, потому что ей нравится общаться и помогать хозяйкам сделать правильный выбор специи. Она продает приправы на прилавке под навесом. И не зависимо от погоды Дилором всегда старается быть на работе, ведь люди не зависимо от погоды и времени хотят есть. А какой вкус еды может быть без ароматных специй. Дилором еще не замужем, возраст 21 год, живет в доме родителей. Она начала свой маленький торговый бизнес когда ей было всего 16 и по сей день успешно продвигает его. 
В данный момент у Дилором закончились запасы приправ и ей не хватает средств для закупа нового товара. Поэтому она решила обратиться за кредитом. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Dilorom works as a salesperson at the Tursunzoda city central market. She sells different types of spices and seasonings to everyone's taste. Dilorom loves her job because she likes to talk with women and help them make the correct selection of spices. She sells seasonings in bulk under an awning. Regardless of the weather, Dilorom strives to be at work, as after all, people want to eat irrespective of the weather or season. And what kind of taste would food have without flavorful spices? 

Dilorom is not yet married. She is 21 years old and lives with her parents. She started her small retail business when she was 16 years old and currently manages its development successfully. At the present time, Dilorom has sold all of her stock of spices and does not have the money to buy new products. That is why she decided to take out a loan. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy spices and seasonings.

loans.name: Zaylobidin

texts.ru: Зайлобидину 38 лет, женат, имеет четверых детей и проживает в городе Турсунзаде. У него имеется приусадебный участок земли, где он посеял капусту. Зайлобидин честный и трудолюбивый человек. На каждый посев урожая он вкладывает душу. Результаты его трудов можете увидеть на фотографии. Зайлобидин занимается растениеводством в течение 10 лет. Сейчас он хочет собрать капустный урожай, провести вспашку земли и посадить морковь и лук. Для нового посева Зайлобидину нужны деньги. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить семена моркови и лука и начать осенний посев. У Зайлобидина большой опыт работы и огромное желание трудиться.
texts.en:
Zaylobidin is 38 years old, married and has four children. He lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He has a household plot of land where he sowed cabbage. Zaylobidin is an honest and hardworking man. He puts an effort into every harvest. You can see the results from his work in the picture.

Zaylobidin has worked with crop production for a period of 10 years. Currently he would like to harvest the cabbage, plow the land and sow carrots and onions. To harvest and sow again, Zaylobidin needs money. He requests a loan in order to start the fall harvest. Zaylobidin has a long experience with the work and a great desire to work.

loans.use: Для закупа семян моркови и лука для осеннего посева

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes et bazins depuis 2010 à domicile, Ama est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite de WAGES un quatrième crédit. Le profit l'aidera à ouvrir une boutique et assurer l'auto-suffisance alimentaire de la famille. Elle est âgée de 29ans.
texts.en:
AMA has been retailing bazin and pagne fabrics (colorful West-African fabrics) from her home since 2010. She is married with two children, one of whom attends school.

To bolster her business, she is requesting a fourth credit loan from WAGES. The profits will help her open a shop and ensure the family's nutritional self-reliance. She is 29 years old.

loans.use: buy bazin and pagne fabrics (colorful West-African fabrics)

loans.name: Ikayat

texts.ru: Икаят 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 8 детей. У Икаят- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Икаят занимается животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Икаят, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель, 16 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Икаят обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Икаят планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ikayat is 54 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising eight children. Ikayat has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Ikayat practices livestock breeding. She started this business 33 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 400 som (KGS). Thanks to Ikayat's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 heifer and 16 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Ikayat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy two heifers to increase the size of her herd. Ikayat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Nikandro

texts.en:
Nikandro is a 33-year-old man. He lives with his mother and aunt in Samtredia district. His mother and aunt are provided with a retirement pension. Nikandro works as a teacher at a local school and gets a small monthly salary, which is not enough for the family. 

Nikandro decided to start a trading business. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get $300 and start a trading with clothes business. He will purchase clothes from the wholesalers and then resell at higher price. The Start-up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to begin trade with clothing.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова и одна воспитывает сына. Фарзона более 5 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи. Фарзона в течении месяца шьет 20-24 платьев. Она шьёт как национальные платья, так и европейские платья. Фарзона имеет большое горе. Ее сын заболел и ей срочно надо лечить сына. Она не имеет денег для лечения сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farzona is a hardworking woman. She is a widow and is raising her son by herself. For more than 5 years, Farzona has had her own business. She offers seamstress services. In the course of a month, Farzona sews 20-24 dresses. She sews both ethnic dresses and European dresses. Farzona has suffered a great misfortune. Her son is sick and she urgently needs to get him treatment. She does not have the money required for her son's treatment. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy medicine for her son's medical treatment. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her son's medical treatment.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулнары - высшее образование, работает в сельской управе социальным работником, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гулнара занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 2 козы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулнара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 35 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Gulnara has higher education and works in the village administration as a social worker. As an additional income for the family, Gulnara works with livestock breeding, after having started 8 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's persistent work, her farm currently has three dairy cows, two horses, two goats and four sheep. The monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulnara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves to increase the number of heads of cattle. Gulnara plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and also plans to save up money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Salama Ii Group

texts.fr:
Evariste  fait partie du groupe Salama II  et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a  34 ans et est mariée  à Suzanne, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés  de 3 mois  à  9 ans, dont  1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce de charbon et de poules  depuis 3 ans. 

C’est  son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 13 poules   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter 2 terrains cultivables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Evariste is part of the Salama II group and lives in Bubanza. He is 34 years old and is married to Suzanne, a shopkeeper. Together they have four children aged from 3 months to 9 years, including one who attends school.

He has been selling coal and chickens for the past three years.

This is his first credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he will increase his working capital and buy 13 chickens for resale, to earn more.

In years to come, he would like to buy two lots of arable land and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy 13 chickens for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Saimo

texts.ru: Саймо умелая швея в возрасте 53 лет. Она разведена, имеет одного сына. Саймо живет в доме у матери, где еще живут ее два братья. Ее сын учится в школе. Сама Саймо работает в больнице уборщицей около 35 лет. Параллельно она занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Саймо шьет женские и детские платья на заказ. Сейчас она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Ее швейная машинка очень устарела и причиняет ей неудобства в процессе шитья. Саймо решила обратиться за кредитом. Она собирается купить новую современную швейную машинку, с помощью которой она будет в состоянии выполнять работы в срок и получать больше заказов. Соответственно ее доход тоже увеличится.
texts.en: Saimo is 53 years old and a skilled seamstress. She is divorced and has one son. Saimo lives at her mother's house, where her two brothers also live. Her son studies at school. Saimo has worked as a cleaning woman in a hospital for about 35 years. At the same time, she has been providing seamstress services. Saimo sews customized women's and children's dresses. Now she wants to expand her business. Her sewing machine is very out of date and causes her problems when she sews. Saimo decided to request a loan. She plans to buy a new, modern sewing machine. With its help, she will be able finish her work on schedule and receive more orders. Her income will also correspondingly increase.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Eulises

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de pepinos y güisquil desde hace 10 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don Jose solicita un credito para comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi él pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
36-year-old Jose lives with his life partner and two children in a house of their own. He has worked growing cucumbers and güisquil [also known as chayote or pear squash] for ten years, which has given him the necessary experience to be able to take care of his own plantations. He sells the harvest at the different marketplaces around his house and with the profits from his sales he covers the home expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides and compost in order to have a good harvesting season and better profits, so that he can offer his family a more stable economy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost, etc.

loans.name: Oscar  Orlando

texts.es: Oscar de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y  su hija, desde hace 3 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, cultiva güisquiles y los comercializa en los alrededores donde el reside,  lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc.  pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en: Oscar is 30 years old. Ge lives in his own home with his life's companion and their daughter. For three years, he has worked in agriculture, which is his main source of income. He grows güisquiles and sells them around the area where he lives. With what he earns from the harvests, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. He wants to buy some materials he needs for his crops, such as fertilizer, pest control, etc. Since he doesn't have the necessary financial resources for such an investment he has made the decision to ask for a loan. This is the only way that he can continue with the growing process. Like every farmer, he put his confidence in agriculture because he has no other source of income and wants to get ahead doing the best he can with his crops. He hopes to obtain an abundant harvest that will allow him to keep bringing home the daily bread and pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana de 24 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo que ya esta en kinder. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 7° grado. Su pareja trabaja como motorista de un vehiculo pesado, en la casa conviven tres personas.

Ana tiene 10 años de experiencia criando y engordando ganado bovino, dicho trabajo lo aprendio de su padre que tambien le gustaba este tipo de animales. Los animales los compra en los tiangues o mercados de ganado, viaja cerca de 5 kilometros al lugar de compra venta mas cercano, hace el negocio y regresa a su casa. Todos los dias se levanta a 5 de la mañana  para alimentarlos y llevarlos al lugar donde pasaran el dia, luego los regresa a las 3 de la tarde.

El préstamo sera usado para comprar 4 animales, según la necesidad que tenga, piensa engordarlos y luego venderlos a un mejor precio. Ana espera con su negocio darle el estudio a su hijo y dejarle algo bueno de herencia.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, is in a relationship and has a son in kindergarten. She could only study up to the seventh grade. Her partner is a truck driver. All three of them live in the same house.

Ana has a 10-year experience raising and fattening cattle, an activity she learned from her father, who also liked this type of animals. She buys the cattle at the different fairs or livestock markets, travelling around 5 km to the closest one. Once she reaches an agreement, she goes back home. She wakes up at 5 am every morning to feed them and taken them to graze until 3 pm, when she takes them back home.

She is requesting a loan to buy four steers. Depending on her needs, she plans to fatten them and sell them at a good price. With her business, Ana hopes to give his son a good education and leave him a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy four steers to fatten.

loans.name: Maycol De Jesús

texts.es: Maycol es un joven emprendedor de 25 años de edad que durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a laborar en el área de la confección pero, debido a la inestabilidad laboral de este oficio, decidió independizarse y generar ingresos por cuenta propia, razón por la cual adecuó un espacio de la casa donde vive con sus padres y allí montó una barbería hace aproximadamente un año. Esta actividad la conoció gracias a un amigo que le enseñó la labor y luego amplió sus conocimientos y perfeccionó sus técnicas cuando se capacitó en una escuela de belleza muy conocida en la ciudad, allí se certificó y ahora su barbería cumple con la normatividad exigida por las autoridades locales, trabaja todos los días y cuenta con la ventaja de no poseer competencia cercana, por lo que ha obtenido muy buenos resultados hasta el momento. Actualmente solicita el apoyo de su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (muebles, lavacabezas, silla de peluquería, 2 puff) y abastecerse de insumos al por mayor (gel para el cabello, cuchillas de afeitar, agua de colonia, entre otros); de esta forma podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo  y aumentará sus ventas, pues sus clientes podrán disfrutar de mayor comodidad y quedarán a gusto con el servicio. Esto se reflejará en el incremento de las ganancias y de esta forma podrá fortalecer su negocio para que sea rentable y le permita ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en: Maycol is a 25 year old young entrepreneur. During his work life he has worked in the area of sewing, but due to the instability of that trade he decided to go off and generate income on his own. That is why he set up a space in his house where he lives with his parents and started a barber shop about a year ago. He learned about this activity from a friend who taught him the work and later he widened his knowledge and perfected his techniques when he trained at a very well known beauty school in his town. He was certified there and now his barber shop complies with the requirements of the local authorities. He works every day and has the advantage of not having competition nearby. He has obtained very good results so far. Right now, he is asking for the help of a loan in his first credit cycle to invest in buying fixed assets (furniture, hair washing sinks, a salon chair and 2 cushions) as well as to buy supplies wholesale (hair gel, razors, cologne, and more). In this way, he will be able to improve his working conditions and increase his sales. His customers will be able to enjoy more comfort and will be happy with the service. This will be reflected in the increase in sales and he will fortify his business so it will be profitable and allow him to offer his family a better quality of life and favorable financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (furniture, a hair washing sink, a salon chair, and 2 cushions) as well as to get supplies wholesale (hair gel, razors, cologne, and more).

loans.name: Jesus Yban

texts.es: El Sr. Jesús  tiene 25 años el   se dedica  a la construcción y pintado de viviendas, es trabaja en distintas obras hasta que termina,   este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, El Sr. Jesús     va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de una habitación para el en su casa  y otros materiales que necesita, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando y tener comodidad en su domicilio, el Sr. Jesús  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material de construcción, el Sr. Jesús  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada,  su deseo es poder producir en mayor cantidad y ofrecer sus servicios a distintos construcciones.
texts.en: Jesús is 25 years old. He works in construction and house painting. He works in different jobs until they are finished. This loan is his first cycle in the institution. Jesús is going to use this loan to buy construction materials to build a room for his house, as well as other materials that he needs. His reason for asking for this loan is to keep improving and making his home comfortable. Jesús is going to use the profits to keep buying a variety of construction materials. He is a very hardworking person and is happy with the opportunity offered. He wants to produce i greater quantities and offer his services in different construction sites.

loans.use: to buy construction material to build a room.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. Juliet is a mother of three children ages 10, 4 and 2. Juliet has been in the business for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income.
 
Juliet is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soap and toiletries, soda and other beverages, and cooking ingredients. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stocks thus allowing her to attract and cater to more buyers in her store.
 
In the future, Juliet hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soap and toiletries, soda and other beverages, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Jenna

texts.en:
Jenna is 32 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jenna has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Jenna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Jenna has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jenna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ma. Jeometela

texts.en:
Ma. Jeometela is 50 years old. She is married and with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jeometela has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Ma. Jeometela requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Ma. Jeometela has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Ma. Jeometela would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de un familiar con sus padres, desde hace 2 años posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra ayudar en los gastos de la casa y también a solventar sus gastos personales, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, azúcar, sopas, pan dulce, etc. para surtir mas su negocio y asi aumentar sus ganancias para seguir ayudando a su familia una tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in a relative’s house with his parents. He has had a shop in his home for two years. He has many customers thanks to the variety of products he sells and the good prices. With the profit he makes, he manages to help paying the expenses of the household and also to cover his personal expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as bulk grains, soft drinks, candy, sugar, soups, “pan dulce” (Salvadorean sweet bread), etc. to better stock his business. This way, he will be able to generate more earnings to continue to help his family and to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, soft drinks, candy, sugar, soups, pan dulce, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La sra.  Maribel tiene un  hijo, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en unas pequeñas parcelas que sus padres le dejaron, la sra. Maribel sufre de una enfermedad por esta causa sigue soltera, realizo una plantación de tomate por los retrasos de la helada todo su cultivo quedo afectado el poco capital que invirtió en su cultivo lo perdió, por causa de este desastre natural y su enfermedad  está siendo muy  afectando la sra. Maribel. 
Maribel es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicado a sus pequeños hijo  y su trabajo pese que ella sufre de una enfermedad  que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura en otras zonas para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a su pequeño hijo, ella  está solicitando el crédito para comprar semilla de frejol y abono orgánico y de esta forma recuperar su capital perdido y mejorara la calidad y el rendimiento de sus cultivos, donde trabaja y de esta manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo y que él  pueda asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Maribel has a child and works in agriculture for a living. She farms the small plots her parents left her. Maribel suffers from a disease and for this reason is still single. She planted tomatoes, but due to late frost the whole crop was damaged and she lost her little capital which she had invested. Maribel is very much affected by this natural disaster and her disease. 

Maribel is much loved and respected in the place where she lives, because she is devoted to her small son and to her work. Although she suffers from a disease she sometimes even works as a day laborer on farms in other areas in order to earn a bit of money to provide for her small son.

She asks for a loan in order to buy bean seed and organic fertilizer and thus regain her lost capital and improve the quality and yield of her crops. By this she would be able to improve the quality of life of her small son and he could go to school in better condition.

loans.use: to buy bean seed and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 55 years old and married with one child in school, Flaviana works very hard to provide for them.

Flaviana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned-goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc..

Flaviana has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Flaviana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned-goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 67 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Norma has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 34 years old and married with two children, both of them are in school. Mary Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Rose would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

Ofelia has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a tricycle transport business as well as from farming sugarcane. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of oysters to sell to her customers.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her sugarcane.

loans.use: to buy more stock of oysters to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is age 45. She lives with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a mechanic by profession. He repairs and services motorcycles as well as the damaged parts of motorcycles. He troubleshoots each motorcycle by taking full responsibility for the repairs. He considers his customers as his friends. Recently he moved his shop to another location due to disputes with the shop owner. Most of the repair tools have been lost and his cylinder air compressor pump stopped working.

Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy a display board, spare parts and a cylinder air compressor pump. In this way, he will be able to provide repair services to his customers. 

Rubina thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a display board, tools and spare parts for her husband's motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 1,0000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Josephine has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from raising pigs and farming rice and corn.  Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been in the rice farming business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income.

Julieta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

In the future, Julieta hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of her income. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bread and tailoring businesses. Veronica is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vivianne

texts.en:
Vivianne is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivianne is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

Vivianne has been raising pigs for two years, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and married with eight children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Wilma has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 28 years, and she earns additional income from fish vending.

Wilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush is an experienced farmer from the village Argina in Armavir region. She lives with her husband and three sons. Her husband works in the village school. Haykush's youngest son is a university student, her eldest son works in the private sector, and the other son is unemployed currently. All the family works hard to be able to cover their everyday basic needs. Haykush is engaged in breeding cows and pigs and in the cultivation of grapes, apples and walnuts. Farming is very important source of income for the family. As their needs are growing day by day, Haykush needs to expand the agribusiness a little bit to meet the costs of the family. She needs a loan of 3000 USD to enlarge and renovate the livestock barn, purchase two steers, buy some forage for the livestock and make previous loan repayments. Haykush and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their support in collecting the needed amount of money and for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to enlarge and renovate the livestock barn, purchase two steers, buy some forage for the livestock and make previous loan repayments

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is an experienced agronomist from Vardaqar village in Shirak region. He lives with his wife and two sons. Khachik is a shepherd. His eldest son is a construction worker and the youngest son is a school-aged boy. To meet the needs of his family he breeds a cows, sheep, pigs and hens. He also cultivates wheat, potatoes and alfalfa. Farming is an important source of income for the family. Khachik's family members help him greatly in everyday farming activities.  

As the life gets more expensive day by day, Khanchik needs to find ways to meet the increasing costs of his family. He currently wants to increase the number of livestock he owns a bit in order for his agribusiness to function more effectively. A loan of 2500 USD will be a huge support to Khachik, enabling him to purchase five steers and to make previous loan repayments. The family highly relies on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping to maintain and improve their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase five steers and to make previous loan repayments.

loans.name: Eusebio Salomon

texts.es: El Sr. Eusebio tiene 22 años,  tiene un  hijo de la edad de dos años, el se dedica a la construcción de puertas y muebles,  tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Puerto Rico de la ciudad de Santa Cruz se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 5 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Eusebio utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de un motor electrico y madera para la construcción de puertas , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo, ya que sin esto no podría realizar puertas,  el Sr. Eusebio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 22 years old and has a two-year-old son. He makes a living building doors and furniture. He has a carpentry which is located in the Puerto Rico area in the city of Santa Cruz. He has been doing this work for five years already, having learned the trade from his father, who was also a carpenter. 

This is his first loan with the institution. Eusebio will use this loan to buy an electric motor and wood to make doors. The reason why he is asking for this loan is that he does not have the capital to buy these materials for his work, and without them he cannot make doors. Eusebio faces challenges with his business, such as to overcome poverty. He will use his profits to improve his quality of life and this is the only work he has to provide for himself and for his family. This is why he is happy and grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy an electric motor.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman and a mother of two children. She lives with her family in the town of Ubay, Bohol. Liezel has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business together with her husband for more than six years now. This is the source of their income. 

Liezel is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. With this, she will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle. In the future, Liezel has hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
