Leliosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a 'buy and sell' rice business in the Philippines.

Leliosa requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Leliosa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Leliosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 34 años de edad, está casada con Marco y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de productos comestibles en general, como arroz, azúcar, harina, etc. también vende gaseosas, chupetes, hielo y jugos envasados, tiene un refrigerador que usa para cumplir con esta actividad, vende sus productos entre sus amistades, familiares y otros clientes eventuales. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 5 años y lo hace con ayuda de su hija o sola. Por otra parte, también cuenta con 2 mototaxis que alquila diariamente por lo cual recibe un pago fijo. Le agrada realizar su trabajo pues puede manejar su tiempo libre para atender a sus pequeños hijos a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación para salir adelante, además se siente feliz por los ingresos económicos que le genera su actividad con los cuales puede apoyar a su esposo a pagar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de seguir trabajando ya que se siente bien y conforme con sus ganancias económicas, pues le da la independencia que ella necesita. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Asegura que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas para que más adelante pueda tener accesos a mayores préstamos. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, azúcar, harina, etc, también diversos paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes tamaños y sabores, además comprará los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar helados como azúcar, leche, bolsas y frutas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 34, is married to Marco and has two children with whom she lives in her own house. Elizabeth works in the sale of grocery staples such as rice, sugar, flour, etc. She also sells sodas, popsicles, ice, and bottled juices. She has a refrigerator that she uses for this. She sells her products to friends, family members, and other occasional customers. She has worked at this job for five years and she does it alone or with the help of her daughter.  What is more, she also has two mototaxis which she rents out daily. For these she receives a fixed payment. 

She likes doing the work because she can adjust her free time so that she can take care of her young children. She loves her kids very much, and they are her reason for moving forward. Additionally, she is happy because of the income that her work generates. With the income she can support her husband in paying household expenses.

She has plans to keep working because she feels great and it fits well with her earnings, because it gives her the independence she needs.  At this time she is asking for 2000 soles. She is pleased to know that she has financial support that allows her to advance with the progress of her business.  She affirms that she will be punctual with her payments so that in the future she can have access to larger loans. With the requested amount, she will buy rice, sugar, flour, etc., and also various packages of sodas in different sizes and flavors.  She will also buy the necessary ingredients, such as sugar, milk, bags, and fruits, to make ice cream treats.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Ivy works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Ivy is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to  buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ivy has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 32 years old and married with one child in school, Editha works very hard to provide for her family.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soap, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Editha has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soap, sugar, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad, aged 62, is a responsible mother, living in a congested house with a huge family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of ten children. Four of her sons have gotten married and live in the same house with their families. She is worried about her remaining three sons who have reached at the age of marriage but she does not have separate rooms for them. She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to cover all the household expenses with poor earnings. 

Their financial condition is very poor because her husband sits idle at home; her four sons do not contribute to household expenses. Her three unmarried sons are doing different kinds of businesses. 

She is taking out a loan for one of her sons; he has been a hawker, selling hair oil by bicycle in the streets of his hometown. He has needed a shop for selling hair oil, and he has hired a tiny shop but does not have money to buy hair oils to sell. Therefore, Irshad requested a loan for her son so that he could become empowered to buy various kinds of hair oil to sell.

She hopes that her son will contribute to household expenses; she wants to construct new rooms for her remaining sons.  Her dream is to spend her old age in peace and calm.

Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy hair oil for newly opened shop.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her 'tablea' making business. Tablea is made from dried and grounded cacao beans shaped like small circles and balls. Tablea is the main ingredients for making hot chocolate. Lucia also runs a small farm with her husband.

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy more cacao bean in making tablea or cacao balls and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her tablea making business as well as the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: to buy more cacao beans used in making 'tablea' (cacao balls) and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of thirteen children, Melba works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Melba is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Nadia is 27 years old and a married women with one daughter, a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  For the past five years, her husband has been driving a taxi, which is the main source of income for their family. She has been teaching children for the past three years at home to help her husband.

As per requirement of circumstances Nadia want to expand her income source by opening a teaching center.She is a member of a 4-person lending group and is requesting a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to help her cover the expenses of her family. This will not only help in improving the family living conditions but will also help in increasing her clients. 

Her personal goals are to provide education and to provide better future to her daughter.

loans.use: To pay for buying a venue for her teaching center.

loans.name: Leny

texts.es: La Sra. Leny sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra  de variedad de ropa para su negocio,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa de temporada ya que se acerca la época de calor,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Leny is continues to sell clothing and reports that the previous loan went very well and she used it to buy a variety of clothing for her business. This time she is asking for a loan to buy seasonal clothing because the hot season is approaching.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for her business

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es: El señor Edmundo tiene  36 años, vive con su esposa en la zona de Candua, vive en un domicilio alquilado, tiene 4 hijos los cuales se encuentra estudiando en la escuela, su fuente de ingresos es por la elaboración de pan de su esposa que realiza en su domicilio todos los días y el señor Edmundo obtiene ingresos  por trabajos de albañil, desarrollan sus trabajos con normalidad a lo largo del año.  Trabajan arduamente todos los días apara así obtener sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alquiler, ropa salud y otros, requiere el crédito para comprar insumos para seguir elaborando pan y así obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos. Su mayor sueño de él es obtener más ingresos y poder tener mejores condiciones de vida y construir una vivienda  y de esta manera tener un techo donde vivir.
texts.en:
Edmundo is 36 years old and lives with his wife in a rented home in Candua. He has four children who are in school. Edmundo says that their source of income is selling bread that his wife makes every day in their home, and the various masonry jobs that he does throughout the year. He says that they work very hard every day to earn money to cover the rent and their other expenses, such as clothing and healthcare.

Edmundo is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to continue making bread so that he can pay for his children’s schooling. He says that his greatest dream is to earn enough money to build his own house so that his family can have better living conditions and a place to call home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to continue making bread.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
This is Alejandra. She previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alejandra dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya. He has two children and has been doing this work for 15 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'High returns!' His biggest challenge is 'Poor transportation.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kairu.'

Stephen was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'low interest rates.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Co-guarantee mechanism.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit his family', Stephen replied 'Good living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Stephen owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is being offered to Ernestina  to improve her business. She  opened her business  in 2003 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her stall like vegetables and tomatoes.   

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy   vegetables and  tomatoes

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three children.
 
Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious food and tea at night. The plastic furniture has broken and needs to be replaced. Due to his poverty, he does not have the money to buy new plastic furniture. Therefore, Sajida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he could buy new plastic furniture such as chairs and tables.
 
Sajida says thanks to Kiva and appreciates the warmth of its support to her.

loans.use: To buy food items and plastic furniture for the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Vive en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y su hija de 1 año de edad, él posee un negocio de vidriería ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, los buenos precios, la amabilidad y responsabilidad que tiene en su trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el cleinte esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maquinaria un taladro, maquina cortadora de vidrio entre otras cosas, a utilizar en su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi el podrá seguir con su trabajo y llaver el pan diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
He lives in a rented house together with his life partner and a 1-year-old daughter. He has a glass workshop at home. His customers appreciate the quality of his work, his good prices and his kind and responsible service. With this business, he manages to cover some of the home expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy a drill and a glass cutting machine, among other things. He will use them in his workshop, which is his only source of income. This way, he will be able to continue working and bringing food to his family’s table every day.

loans.use: to buy a drill and a glass cutting machine.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y venta de Pan, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra  de  material de construcción para el techo de su horno,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca y levadura para la elaboración de pan,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Maribel continues making and selling bread. She says that she made good use of the previous loan and could buy materials to build a roof for her oven. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour, shortening and yeast to make bread. She feels happy and appreciates the opportunity she is given to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery, such as shortening and flour.

loans.name: Herodita

texts.en:
Herodita works hard to support her family. Herodita has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Herodita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

In the future, Herodita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Rigardina

texts.en:
Rigardina is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Rigardina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

A $600 loan is offered to Rigardina to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies of tomato. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and widow with three children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Jocelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, bread, soft drinks, milk, etc. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, bread, soft drinks, milk, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Arcides

texts.es: Francisco vive con esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia, don francisco es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor,  desde a hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita
texts.en:
Don Francisco is very responsible, hardworking, and entrepreneurial. He and his wife live in their own home with their three children. 

Don Francisco has for several years run a farm and sold dairy products in the region near his home. Offering quality dairy products at good prices has allowed Don Francisco to build a strong base of customers who trust him. 

Don Francisco also invests in the care of his herd because his farm depends on the animals. He is therefore applying for a loan to finance the purchase of vitamins for the herd and to pay off the purchase price of a milking cow. Don Francisco expects that these transactions will yield good results and help grow his business. He'll then be able to keep providing his family whatever they need.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and a dairy cow

loans.name: Sherlina

texts.en:
Sherlina is a married woman and a mother of six children, from Ubay, Bohol. For more than ten years, she has been engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband. This is their main source of her income.

Sherlina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores de 41 años de edad,  es casado y tiene cuatro hijos y solo tres van a la escuela. Solo estudio hasta 7° grado, su esposa es ama de casa y ademas trabaja en un comedor. En casa cuatro personas conviven con él.

Dolores tiene 5 años de dedicarce a la cria y venta de cerdos, aprendio gracias a un amigo agricultor tambien, cuando los cerditos estan listos, sale con uno de sus hijos a venderlos a las comunidades vecinas, no tiene horario de trabajo, puede venderlos en tres horas asi como puede estar todo el dia.
En casa gran parte de su tiempo lo dedica a cuidar sus animales, que son su principal fuente de ingreso.

El prestamo sera utilizado para comprar cerditos, engrodarlos y luego venderlos a un mejor precio. La meta de dolores es poder tener una buena porqueriza y generar mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores is 41 years old, married, and has four children.  Only three go to school.  He has only a 7th grade education. His wife is a housewife and also works at an eatery.  Four people live with him at home.  For the past 5 years Dolores has been working at raising and selling pigs, and he learned about it thanks to a farmer-friend.  When the pigs are ready he goes with one of his children to sell them in the neighboring communities. He has no schedule for this as it can take three hours to sell them or all day.

At home he spends a lot of time taking care of his animals which are his main source of income.  The loan will be used to buy piglets, fatten them up and then sell them at a better price.  Dolores' goal is to have a good pig farm and to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fatten them up

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She has two children. 

She is a farmer and has been doing this work for 30 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops. She says what is most enjoyable about farming is "Good profits!" Her biggest challenge is "Insufficient water." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Mwendwa" and "Kanini."

Lucy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Quick services." She was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Members guarantee each other."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Lucy replied, "Good living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lucy owns  a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Lucy has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, a TV, a DVD but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 7 children and has been doing this work for 20 years. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Planting maize!' His biggest challenge is 'getting losses.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tuiyoi and chemur.'

Richard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Low interest rate.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to save little by little.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family,' Richard replied 'Improved milk production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Richard owns the following: 'cow' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a married man and a father of three children from Ubay, Bohol. 

He runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place.
 
Reynaldo wants to avail a loan for his store. He is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries among others. With this, he will be able to improve the variety of his stocks, thus allowing him to attract and cater to more buyers in his store. Reynaldo hopes to make his business a success and save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a nipa weaver from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two young children. 

Salome is asking for a loan to buy  more materials for nipa weaving like nipa, rattan and bamboo. With this, she will be able to weave more, thus allowing her to sell more of her woven products.

In the future, Salome hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more income for the needs of the family like for food consumption and to pay for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more materials for nipa weaving like nipa, rattan and bamboo.

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida, 48, is happily married to Arnold and blessed with three children. She is engaged in a welding shop business. She aspires to live a good life through managing the business well, which has been her family's source of income. However, without enough funds her business will not become competitive and certainly will not attain good income. 

For this reason, Naida is requesting additional capital: a loan of PHP 10,000 that will be used to buy rubber, interiors, and other supplies and tools needed to maintain their welding services.

loans.use: to buy rubber, interiors, and other supplies and tools needed to maintain their welding services.

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, esta acompañado y con su pareja procrearon 7 hijos, de 2, 8, 10, 12, 18, 25 y de 29 años de edad; solo el mayor de sus hijos trabaja, los demas estudian. Su esposa es comerciante, vende frutas y verduras, pero tambien lo apoya en los trabajos agricolas.

José es agricultor y productor ganadero, tiene 40 años trabajando de esta manera agradece a sus padre por enseñarle todo lo que sabe. En el negocio del ganado estan involucrados todos sus hijos, pues de alguna manera le apoyan en los cuidos de los animales.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes para una parcela de Maíz que tiene establecido. Espera tene una buena cosecha y que el grano tenga buen precio para venderlo, comprar ganado lechero, con los restos del cultivo alimentar su ganado.
texts.en:
José is a 54-year-old farmer and rancher who lives with his partner and their seven children, ages 29, 25, 18, 12, 10, 8 and 2. The oldest child works, but the others are all in school. José's wife sells fruits and vegetables but also helps him with farm labor. 

José has worked in agriculture for 40 years since his father taught him everything he knows. All of José's children help him on the farm, doing the various tasks required to care for the ranch animals.  

José will use this loan to purchase fertilizer for a plot of land where he's planted corn. He expects a strong harvest and a good price when he sells the corn. This income will allow José to purchase a dairy herd that he can feed with the remaining corn.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, age 38, is a responsible mother, living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her third loan with the BRAC Pakistan. She is an experienced member. Asia wants to continue to be a member of BRAC Pakistan and wants to take additional loans in the future. 

Asia belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to feed all of her seven children each day. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been running this business for many years. His shop is situated near his hometown.  

Due to a rapid increase in the family's needs and household expenses, Asia's husband wants to grow his purchasing power related to scrap. Therefore, Asia requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs in the future.  

Asia is very impressed with this honorable support and shares her wish to take a huge loan after this loan. She says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Violenda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Violenda works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal and food vending. 

Violenda is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, etc. for her food vending business.

Violenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, etc. for her food production

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Ronnie successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business.

NWTF is re-listing Ronnie's business profile again in support of his efforts to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, de 2 años de edad y 6 años de edad, solamente el mayor estudia. José solo estudio hasta 2° grado, su esposa vente productos de belleza por catalogo, en casa conviven 3 personas con él.

Es agricultor desde pequeño, se dedican a la siembra de hortalizas como el pipian, tambien tiene 4 años de trabajar como albañil. El lugar de la siembre se encuentra a 30 minutos a pie desde su casa.

El préstamo sera utilizado para reparar la vivienda, que estan cambiando el techo, para vivir mas comodamente sin que se filtre el agua durante las lluvias.

En un futuro, espera terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and married. He lives with three people. His two children are 2 and 6 years old; only the older child is in school. His wife sells beauty products from a catalog.

José only went to school until second grade. He has been a farmer since he was young, growing vegetables like gourds. The location of his crops is a thirty-minute walk from his house. He has also worked in construction for four years.

The loan will be used to repair the house. They are replacing the roof so they can live more comfortably, without water coming in during the rains. 

In the future, José hopes to finish building his house and for his children to finish school.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Farah Group

texts.en:
Farha, a 33-year-old woman, is a mother of two children living in one of the poorly developed areas of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

With the meager salary of her husband, she is feeling difficulties running the kitchen and meeting the needs of her children. To help her husband, she is stitching clothes at home and selling them to the central bazaar.

As member of a two-person group, she has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her tailoring business, which she has been running since 10 years.
  
She is confident that the loan can help the family to get a considerable jump to their monthly income.

loans.use: To expand her business by obtaining a shop.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher runs a motorcycle business in Mombasa, Kenya, where he also resides. He is a married man with four school-going children. He is employed himself so he has someone running the business for him. He has been in this business for the last two years and the business has been improving. He hopes that in five years time his business will grow and enable him to buy a public service vehicle. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle. The major challenge in the business is the stiff competition. He will use the extra income to educate his children and give theme a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Dagvadorj, 43 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been producing and selling diary products to local people since 2010. In order to improve his product quality, he purchased packaging equipment using his previous loan. This time he is requesting a loan of 7,700,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he wants to repair and insulate the old house which he bought at a low price. 

Dagvadorj thinks living in a house is way better than living in a Mongolian tradition 'ger' even though the house is many years old and has deteriorated. After renovation of his house, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, emitting fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 35-year-old single man. He is a Syrian citizen who works and lives in Lebanon. He is the sole breadwinner of two members of his family. That's why he has to work hard and put so much effort into improving his socioeconomic situation. In 2008, he opened his current shop to improve his living.

Hussein is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new tailoring machine. He will also use a part of the loan to support his family through responding to some of their additional needs. 

In the future, Hussein is hoping to buy his own shop instead of paying rent for the current working place.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Elena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Elena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 43 years old and has ten children. Warlita is married and has four children who are in school.

Warlita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Warlita has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Warlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sharlene Margie

texts.en:
Sharlene Margie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sharlene Margie is 39 years old and both her children are in school.

Sharlene Margie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, biscuits, sardines and other groceries.

Sharlene Margie has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, biscuits, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en: This time, Jessebel is borrowing a new loan of PHP 17,000 to buy more fish to sell to customers. Her fish-vending business was previously funded though Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) and Kiva, to continue to provide for Jessebel and her family an increased income, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early 30's, is married with three school girls. For three years now, Regina has been running a business selling charcoal in two places. She is doing great in her business. She works  from 7 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a fair return per month. 

This will be her twelfth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Regina used her previous loans to buy more charcoal for her business  and to prepare her new charcoal store when she opened another branch. Regina has paid back all her previous loans successfully. With the business profit earned,she covered her household expenses and school fees and saved the remaining portion in her bank account.  Regina will use this loan to restock more sacks in her new charcoal business. She dreams that one day she will be able to provide her girls with better education and build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Tupendane C" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more sacks in her new charcoal business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 31-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children, from Bien Unido, Bohol. For more than ten years, she has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Dina is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to go back to fishing and improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Dina wants to improve their fishing business, so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has three children and has been doing this work for ten years. Her primary income sources are tea and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Tea picking." Her biggest challenge is "Poor weather when it rains or too dry." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Mungale."

Jackline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Assist farmers."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Train farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit her family?." Jackline replied "Change their livelyhood."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jackline owns the following: "poultry" but does not own "cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net" but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 54 years old, married and has three children. 

Imelda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, a 49-year-old widowed mother of four children, three of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years, she has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nyauma

texts.en:
Nyauma is married with seven children. He lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. For 20 years, Nyauma has been a farmer and his primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and his personal business. His most enjoyable aspect of farming is the good bonus from tea farming and his biggest business challenge is changing prices. Animals on Nyauma’s farm have been named “Nyabarati.” When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for his loan, Nyauma replied, “it has good terms and conditions.” He learned that Juhudi assists the public with funds during his required microfinance training session. Nyauma’s greatest monthly expense is school fees and he hopes his loan will improve his status. 

Nyauma is requesting a loan to construct a dairy barn. As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Nyauma owns a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. His household has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to build a dairy barn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some furniture for her place of work

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, for the expansion of her husband's welding shop, which her husband has been running for the past ten years. 

Kosar is 59 years old, a well-educated, married woman with five sons, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  

Kosar wants the financing, so that she can provide a better future to her children and this will allow her to increase her monthly savings, as well. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one and will greatly help in the progress of her husband's welding shop.

loans.use: to pay for expansion of her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 45-year-old, married father of three children, who has a small restaurant specializing in selling the Lebanese traditional breakfast meals, “Foul and Hummus,” which is a bean-related food. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in Lebanon.

In 1997, Mahmoud opened his current business and he is well-known in his region, with the special taste and cleanliness that he provides. He is his family's sole breadwinner, that's why he has to work hard to improve his productivity, which will reflect on his family’s socioeconomic situation. He has 23 years of experience in this domain, long enough to acquire a special talent and customers’ trust.

Mahmoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a power generator, which is necessary for his business, especially because electricity is a major problem in Lebanon. 

In the future, Mahmoud is willing to expand his business, hopefully through moving to a larger place.

loans.use: to buy a power generator for his restaurant.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her which enabled the purchase of more ingredients to cook for her food stall. In this business for 12 years now, she has seen its growth over the years. Her income is a big help for the family's everyday expenses.

Trinidad is requesting another 20,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients including rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Trinidad hopes for the continuous growth of her enterprise and dreams of helping her children in every way she can. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that meet on a weekly basis  to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is 31 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has run a bakery in the Philippines. Jenipher is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenipher is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her bakery. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her bakery

loans.name: 04-14-08-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hà is 32 years old and married with a child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. For almost a year, Hà has operating a shipping business. Her biggest business hardship is her lack of capital.

Hà is requesting a loan to purchase a means of transport for her shipping business. She is the group leader of the 04-14-08-Nam Ngạn solidarity group which consists of four members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With the profit from her loan, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase a means of transport for her shipping business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Margarita de 72 años de edad, con su anterior credikia; ella es habitante del suroccidente de la ciudad, y tiene 7 hijos en las edades de 32 a 48 años y desde hace 23 años se mantiene trabajando en la venta de mercancías; experiencia que recibió de sus padres, a quienes ayudó en este mismo tipo de negocio. Cuando fue mayor de edad y  su cónyuge falleció, la obligación de su familia la orilló a que se dedicara a la actividad comercial, para poder responder a los gastos de su hogar. Ella tiene una clientela fija, a quienes a través de llamadas promociona la  mercancía con la que cuenta y también toma los pedidos de esta en la misma forma. Sus ventas las realiza con una frecuencia semanal y de contado, mientras sus compras las hace a proveedores, en el centro de la ciudad. Entre sus clientes se destacan sus propios vecinos, amigos y referidos por estos, clientes con los que se apoya, para continuar creciendo cada vez más, porque su meta es continuar generando ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, financiamiento número 19,que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará sabanas, manteles, cubre lechos y utensilios plásticos domésticos. Con su crédito surtirá más ampliamente su negocio, para atraer una gran demanda y convertir a su credikiva, una vez mas,  en una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Thank you for having supported 72-year-old Margarita with her previous Kiva loan. 

Margarita is a resident of the southwest part of the city and has seven children ranging in age from 32 to 48 years old. For 23 years, she has supported herself by working in sales; she got her experience by helping her parents in the same type of business. After she grew up and her husband passed away, family responsibilities obliged her to work in sales to be able to cover her household costs.

Margarita has a regular clientele. Through sales calls, she sells the merchandise that she has and takes orders. She sells on credit on a weekly basis and makes her purchases from suppliers in the city center. Among her customers are her own neighbors and friends along with new customers referred by them. With this customer base, she supports herself and continues expanding her business; her goal is to continue generating income to pay for her daily needs.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan —her 19th— through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will buy sheets, tablecloths, bedspreads, and plastic household utensils. She will stock her business better in order to attract more business and once again turn her Kiva loan into a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, tablecloths, bedspreads, and plastic household utensils.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and married with one kid. For the past seven years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling rice. Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Arlene is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 40 years old, a male and married. He has three children who are 15, 10, and 5 years old, whom he supports, and he has a barber shop. He has been in this business, which is located at Watamu, for three years. In his business he earns a monthly income of 5,000 KSH (Kenya shillings). He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer  He is taking his first loan of 10,000 KSH which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying towels, machines, and spirits to increase his customers. John will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hope and dream for his future business and family is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy spirits and towels to serve his customers well.

loans.name: Shakhnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Шахнозы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шахноза занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шахнозы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шахноза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шахноза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Shakhnoza is 30 years old, married, and is raising two children with her husband. Shakhnoza has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Shakhnoza is involved in raising livestock, having started six years ago with the purchase of cattle for 15,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Shakhnoza today has on her homestead: two dairy cows and five sheep. Monthly income comes to 8,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Shakhnoza turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow for increasing her count of cattle. 

Shakhnoza plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the count of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Uultay

texts.ru: Уултай 47 лет, разведена, одна воспитывают 4 детей. У Уултай - высшее образование, работает библиотекарем в школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Уултай занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Уултай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная коровы, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уултай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Уултай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей
texts.en:
Uultay is 47 years old, divorced, and is raising four children on her own. Uultay has a higher education and works as a school librarian. As a main source of income for her family, Uultay is involved in raising livestock, having started nine years ago with the purchase of cattle for 20,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Uultay today has on her farm: one dairy cow and one calf. Monthly income consists of 8,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Uultay turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows for increasing the headcount of cattle. 

Uultay plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es: Ana de 61 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hija logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, lociones, etc. ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 61 years old, earns her living selling all kinds of personal-use products like lotions, deodorants, perfumes, etc. Her business is located in her residence. With the profits she makes from her sales, and with the help of her daughter, she is able to cover her household costs. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her daughter, who works and helps her with the bills. 

Ana would like to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs, like perfumes, nail polishes, deodorants, lotions, etc. She has many customers waiting for these products at accessible prices. With the help she has requested, she will be able to increase her earnings and thereby continue to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, nail polishes, deodorants, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel, who is 34 years old. She is married to Alexander and they have children. Raquel is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She and her husband manage their household while operating a variety store. Raquel works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all the items in the store. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP worth cooking oil, or an egg. Raquel earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Raquel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and continue to operate her business. She dreams that her business will grow bigger and she hopes that her family will have their own house.  Raquel meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: 04-16-05-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 33 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. For the past three years, Hiền has run a business selling clothing. Her biggest business hardship is the lack of capital.

Hiền is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to sell. She is the group leader of the 04-16-05-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. This will be Hiền’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат 76 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала двоих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Шарапат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шарапат занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шарапат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 овца. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шарапат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шарапат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Sharapat is a 76-year-old widow. After the death of her husband, she raised two children on her own, and now runs her own homestead. Sharapat has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Sharapat is engaged in raising livestock, having started 23 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Sharapat today has on her homestead: four dairy cows and one sheep. Monthly income consists of 10,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Sharapat turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and a calf for expanding the livestock headcount. 

Sharapat plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the quantity of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf

loans.name: Bubuaisha

texts.ru: Бубуайше 54 года, вдова, одна воспитывает 3 детей. У Бубуайши- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бубуайша занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубуайши, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубуайша обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бубуайша планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Bubuaisha is 54 years old, a widow, and raised three children on her own. Bubuaisha has a specialized high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Bubuaisha is involved in raising livestock, having started 18 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Bubuaisha now has one her homestead: one dairy cow and one calf. Monthly income consists of 7,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Bubuaisha turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. 

Bubuaisha plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the quantity of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Noe De Jesús

texts.es:
Noe de 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, los dos menores todavia viven con él. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado, su esposa es ama de casa y lo apoya con los trabajos agricolas.

Noe es  comerciante de ganado bovino, por 4 años a trabajado comprando animales, engordandolos y luego vendiendolos a mejor precio. Pero agricultor a sido desde su niñez y agradece a su padre por haberle enseñado.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar 2 terneros, engordarlos y procurar venderlos a buen precio.

Espera seguir trabajando de esta manera, para que con el tiempo se haga de su ato ganadero, quiza tener ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Noe is 56 years old, married, and has three children.  The two youngest still live with him.  He was only able to study to the fourth grade.  His wife is a homemaker and helps him with the farm work.
 
Noe is a cattle merchant and has been buying and selling animals, fattening them up, and selling them for four years, but he has been a farmer since he was a child and he is grateful to his father for having taught him.
 
He will use this loan to buy two steers, fatten them up, and sell them for a good price.

He hopes to continue working in this way so that he can have a cattle herd and maybe also have some dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weigh scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es un joven muy luchador de la ciudad de Paraguarí, quiere recibirse para poder ayudar a su familia y a su comunidad por medio de su trabajo.
Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y comenta que quiere poder tener su propia empresa, para poder aplicar todo lo que ha aprendido.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y así seguir estudiando y luchar por su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alvaro is a hardworking young man from the city of Paraguarí. He would like to graduate so that he can help his family and his community with his job.

He is studying Business Administration and says that he would like to be able to own his own business so that he can apply all that he has learned.

He requests this loan so that he can pay his university fees so that he can continue to study and work towards his goal.

loans.use: to pay his university bills.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 21 años, es la hija mayor de 2 hermanos, es estudiante de una de las mejores universidades del país, cursando el 4° año de la carrera de Derecho.
Su meta es graduarse de Abogada y especializarse en Derecho Penal, abrir un Estudio Jurídico con un Título de Doctorado. Ella lucha por ser alguien en la vida y así poder ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el gasto de sus clases diarias, ya que siempre hay algún gasto que tener que cubrir. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old, has two younger brothers, and is studying at one of the best universities in the country. She is in her fourth year and is studying law.

Her goal is to graduate as an attorney, specialize in criminal law, and open a law firm with a doctorate degree. She is working hard to be someone in life and to be able to help those who need it.

She requests this loan to pay for her university classes, since there is always some expense that she has to cover. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving and believes that it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to pay for her university classes.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a married man from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for several years now. 

Fernando is requesting a loan to repair his fishing boat. He will use his loan to return to fishing, increase his catch, and be able to sell more fish to the market. In the future, Fernando hopes to make his fishing business a successful and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Pardabek

texts.ru: Пардабек из района Зафаробод. Ему 36 лет. Почти 5 лет Пардабек разводит крупный рогатый скот. Прибыль с животноводства единственный источник дохода их семьи. Пардабеку в ведении бизнеса помогает супруга и старший сын. В данный момент в его скотном дворе остался один бычок. Он просит кредит, чтобы закупить 4-х голов бычков для увеличения поголовья продаваемого скота. Для такого бизнеса как у него, размер кредита маленький, потому, что быки стоят очень дорого. Пардабек любит свою работу и хочет расшириться. Разводить быков, то есть ухаживать и кормить их не легкая работа, но Пардабеку не страшны трудности. Его работа кормит и Пардабека и его жену с детьми. Он счастливый отец троих сыновей. Пардабек очень любит свою семью и старается все время ради их блага. Поддержите его!
texts.en:
Pardabek is from the Zafarobod region. He is 36 years old. For nearly five years, Pardabek has been breeding cattle. Profit from raising livestock is the only source of income for the family. Pardabek is helped in running the business by his wife and eldest son. Currently, he has one steer in his barnyard. 

He is requesting a loan to buy four heads of steer for increasing the count of salable cattle. For such a business as his, the size of loans is quite small because steer are very expensive. Pardabek loves his work and wants to expand. Raising steers, that is to care for and feed them, is not an easy job, but Pardabek is not afraid of challenges. 

His work feeds Pardabek, his wife and children. He is the happy father of three sons. Pardabek loves his family very much and strives all the time for their well-being.

loans.use: to buy four heads of steer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a scale to provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ann works hard to support her family. She runs a restaurant in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF.

Ann is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a first time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI), applying for 1,000,000 (One Million) Uganda Shillings. She is a single mother of one child that she lives with in one of the rental units in a city slum of Kamwokya. 

She is a tailor and operates a small retail shop in the same place where she stays. That has helped her be able to take care of her child. Besides looking after her child, she has managed to buy a small plot of land in Kito, Kirinya. Her major challenge is renting for so long and being overcharged for rent, yet she has her plot which is undeveloped. 

This has forced her to start building a simple house that she would like to occupy in the near future, but she is being constrained by financial challenges. That is why she is applying for the loan. Her future plan is to work hard finish her house and pay well the loan to have a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a simple house on her plot of land.

loans.name: Philes

texts.en:
Philes has two children and lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. For the past 10 years, she has been a farmer who produces eggs, tea, and other crops. Philes finds earning profits to be most enjoyable about farming and her biggest challenge is competition. Animals on her farm are named Nyandabu. Philes chose Juhudi Kilimo for her loan because the percentage rate is so low. When she took Juhudi’s required microfinance training session, she learned that Juhudi offers funds. 

Philes is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Her highest monthly expense is farming costs and her loan will help her to enlarge her family business. As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Philes owns a cow and poultry, but doe not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. She owns a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Bayraa

texts.en:
Mr. Bayraa, 55 years old, lives with his wife and grandchild in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting people since 2000. 

Currently he has rented out all his buses and decided to render a taxi service to local people. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to buy a natural gas vehicle. The natural gas vehicle wastes less fuel per kilometer traveled, and also releases cleaner emissions to the environment.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas vehicle.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.ru: Зинат молодая незамужняя девушка, ей 30 лет. Она живет с родителями в городке Вахдат. Зинат умеет шить и кроить женские национальные платья, а также делать на них красивые вышивки. До этого времени она шила только для себя. Теперь Зинат решила использовать свое умение и мастерство на профессиональном уровне. Она собирается начать швейное дело и принимать заказы у себя дома. Она уже отвела отдельную комнату для этой деятельности. У нее в доме есть старая швейная машинка, которой более 30 лет. Эта машинка механическая, поэтому ее ручку придется все время крутить, чтобы она работала. Зинат просит кредит для покупки новой современной машинки, благодаря которой он смогла бы шить быстрее и качественнее. На сумму кредита Зинат хочет приобрести компьютерную швейную машинку и ткани для шитья. Она планирует вышивать за день одно обычное платье и одно платье с вышивкой. В начале деятельности ей будут помогать мать и сестра.
texts.en:
Zinat is a young, unmarried woman. She is 30 years old. She lives with her parents in the town of Vahdat. Zinat knows how to sew and cut women's national dresses, as well as to make beautiful embroidery on them. Until now, she has sewed only for herself. Now, Zinat has decided to use her skills and mastery on a professional level. She is going to start sewing and taking orders out of her home. She has already set aside a room for these activities. At her home she has an old sewing machine which is more than 30 years old. This machine is manual and therefore her hands will have to hold on the whole time to twist in order for her to work. 

Zinat is requesting a loan for the purchase of a new modern machine, thanks to which she will be able to sew with more speed and quality. With the loan sum, Zinat wants to acquire a computerized sewing machine and fabric for sewing. She plans to sew one ordinary dress every day and one dress with embroidery. At the start of activities, she will be helped by her mother and sister.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric for opening a sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 62 years old and married with five grown up children. Despite her current age she remains strong enough to manage well her hog-raising business for a living. "Time is Gold" is her motto in life, thus she really makes the best of her time doing good deeds. 

Rosalina is asking for a loan to buy feed and an additional head of piglets for her business to grow. With the business she hopes to save income for future use.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional an head of piglets for her business to grow.

loans.name: Naseem Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 49-year-old women and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. She is a member of 2-person lending group requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants the financing to invest in her tailoring business for the help of her husband. As this shop is the only source of income for their family, she wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy.

She is very experienced and professional in her dealings and has been operating her business for the past ten years. Naseem is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and bring positive changes in the life of their family.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old single man who has been working in a restaurant for two years. He is a Syrian citizen living and working in Lebanon. Ahmad is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a smoothie machine to start his own business, which he is hoping will increase his income and develop his living.

In the future, Ahmad is willing to open his own business.

loans.use: to buy a smoothie machine

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
Мавзуна порядочная и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она вдова. Мавзуна живет в сельской местности и поэтому занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает зерно и картофель. Мавзуна имеет второй бизнес. Она занимается скотоводством. Мавзуна откармливает скот за счет кормов собственного производства. Мавзуна откармливает скот несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес. Мавзуна запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота, для того, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. 
Это ее второй займ в ИМОНе. Она имеет хорошую кредитную историю.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is a decent and cheerful woman. She is 28 years old. She is a widow. Mavzuna lives in a rural area and therefore is involved in the cultivation of crops. She mainly grows grain and potatoes. 

Mavzuna has a second business. She is involved in raising livestock. Mavzuna fattens cattle with feed that she produces on her own. Mavzuna fattens cattle for a few months and sells them at the local market. She wants to develop her business. Mavzuna is requesting a loan of US$2,000 to purchase cattle in order to increase her working capital. 

This is her second loan from IMON. She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a ready-to-wear products and a direct-selling business for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed for her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elsa hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand. She dreams to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

Amy requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Amy is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp to have a good light-source during the rainy season.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 28 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mylen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mylen requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mylen has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Mylen would like to save enough money to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилором является женщиной в возрасте 49 лет имеет среднее образование, имеет 2 сыновей и одну дочку. У Дилором есть дехканское хозяйство и несколько скотов. Старший сын находиться в Российской федерации. Откорму скота она научилась   в раннем возрасте, так как ее родители всю жизнь занимались этим. По финансовым причинам Дилором не смогла получить образование поэтому она занимается сельскохозяйственным делами и скотоводством. На данный момент это единственный доход в их семье.
Каждое утро Дилором отвозит свой скот на пастбище так как там много трав, а после обеда занимается выращиванием культур. Дилором очень добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Она никогда не сидит без дела. Старается делать все чтобы ее дети не нуждались ни в чем. 
Дилором нуждается в денежных средствах,поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за помощью. Она планирует взять кредит и купить несколько голов скота. Очень надеется на помощь и поддержку от Арванд.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a 49-year-old woman, high school educated, and has two sons and one daughter. Dilorom has a private farm and a few cattle. Her elder son is in the Russian Federation. She learned fattening cattle from an early age, as her parents have been doing this all of her life. For financial reason, Dilorom was not able to get an education, therefore she is involved in agricultural work and raising livestock. At the moment, this is the only income for their family.

Every morning, Dilorom drives her cattle to pasture as there are many grasses, and after lunch she is involved in growing crops. Dilorom is a very good and hardworking person. She never sits idle. She is trying to do everything in order for her kids not to need anything.
