Dilorom needs monetary resources, so she turned to Arvand for help. She plans to take a loan to buy a few head of cattle. She has high hopes for help and support from Arvand.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ana Iris

texts.es: ana vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos,  producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Ana lives in a home of her own, along with her two children.  She is very well known for her humility and dedication to her work where she lives.  She has never given up and has always gotten ahead despite her challenges.  Through her efforts and dedication, she has a store and sells primary needs products such as basic grains, milk, eggs, rice, and other things.  She is very dedicated to her work and very helpful when making her sales, and this is why her customers seek her out and prefer her products.  She has seen the need to stock her store a bit more, given the increase in demand, but she doesn’t have the capital, so she is asking for a loan to buy products such as basic grains, instant products, snacks, drinks, etc.  She trusts in God that she will soon receive the help she is asking for, and she will have no more worries in supporting her household.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 23 years old, a female, and married. She has two children, 4 and 1 years old, who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and she has a retail shoe shop. She has been in this business for three years and is located at Watamu.

In her business she earns a monthly income of 4000 Kes. She is taking her first loan of 15000 Kes, which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying beads, shoes, and leather. Lucy will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by opening a curio shop.

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy beads, shoes, and leather for making shoes for her customers.

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru: Ганчина в ИМОНе кредитуется первый цикл. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая девушка. Ганчина родилась в сельской местности в семье простого рабочего. Ее отец простой рабочий, а мать учительница в сельской местности. Ганчина с детства мечтала поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Ганчина после окончание средней школы поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Она является одной из успешных студентов. Ганчина запрашивает займ на сумму 400 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ganjina is borrowing from IMON for the first time. She is a conscientious and hardworking young woman. Ganjina was born in a rural area into a family of simple workers. Her father is a simple worker and her mother is a rural teacher. 

Since childhood, Ganjina has dreamed of going to university to receive a higher education. After graduating from high school, Ganjina enrolled in the Tajik State University of Commerce. She is one of the more successful students. 

Ganjina is requesting a loan of US$400 to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with two school-aged children. She is engaged in selling different vegetables and fruits in their community. 

Her desire to make improvement in the business pushes her to ask for loan assistance from lenders that she will use to buy more cabbages, tomatoes, beans and bananas to sell. 

She is a happy person and always wears a good smile for her regular customers in the business. She hopes someday to further expand her vending to meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, tomatoes, beans, and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Хикматулло молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 18 лет. Он в этом году окончил успешно среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. В средней школе он учился отлично и хорошо. Хикматулло в университете учится успешно. Он часто посещает библиотеку и читает классическую литературу. Хикматулло в свободное время разгадывает кроссворды. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo is a young and energetic person. He is 18 years old. This year, he successfully graduated from high school and enrolled in the Tajik State University of Commerce. In high school, he was an excellent student. 

Hikmatullo is studying successfully in university. He often visits the library and reads classical literature. In his spare time, Hikmatullo does crossword puzzles. 

He needs to pay tuition and with this aim is requesting a loan of US$800.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Roribel

texts.en:
This is Roribel, 40, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Roribel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Roribel hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams that her children will have a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Aasba

texts.en: Aasba is a 33-year-old hardworking independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and six sons. All of her children are studying in third class. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For four years Aasba has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva, and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Caseline

texts.en:
Caseline lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Profits earned.' Her biggest challenge is 'Climate.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyabarati.'

Caseline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Affordable rate.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Offers loans to people.'

Her highest monthly expenses are farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Caseline replied 'Improve farming.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Caseline owns the following: 'cow and poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 35-year-old woman. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 2 daughters and 3 sons, and all of her children are going to an ordinary government school. The financial condition of her family is not good; her husband is a tailor by profession and his work mostly consists of boom periods such as festivals. 

Her husband conducts a tailoring business in which he provides services of sewing clothes for his customers. He is an expert in his profession and people like his stitched clothes a lot. Due to Eid-ul-Azha, the burden of work has increased and he is unable to complete his tasks alone. He appointed a new worker to his shop temporarily and need a sewing machine for the new worker.

Therefore, Saba requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new Juki machine to reduce his burden of work.

Saba is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a juki machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 40 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. She has been working as an assistant cook at a restaurant since 2009. Her husband renders a taxi service to local people. 

The house her family lives in has deteriorated over the years, so she is requesting a loan to renovate her house. The loan of 4000000 MNT will be used for buying necessary building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. After the renovation her family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Patience and determination has been Myrna's guiding principle in life. She is from the local community of Cordon, married, and has been blessed with three grown up children. Myrna's husband is a farmer while she operates a general store within their locality.

She has run a general store for over 10 years. Aside from retailing, she also engages in a livestock raising business. She is grateful because her previous loan has helped her much in the improvement of her income and with the businesses she has. 

This time Myrna is seeking another loan for additional capital amounting to PHP 7,000, which will be used to buy grocery items and four bags of hog feed. She knows that having a complete set of grocery items to offer will enable her to gradually achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and four bags of hog feed.

loans.name: Ngara Group

texts.en:
Juma, who is in his early 30s, is single with a boy who is in school. For five years now, Juma has had a mini-supermarket business. He works from 7am to 10pm each working day and is able to make a very good profit each month. 

This is Juma's sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to buy more out-of-stock products and a popcorn machine. He used his previous loans to replenish his business products and to buy two big business fridges. He has paid back all of his loans successfully. Juma used his profit to pay school fees, to pay for household expenses, to reinvest back into the business, and to save. Juma dreams that one day he will be able to own a big supermarket.

He will share this loan with his loan group "NGARA," which has six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more out-of-stock products and a popcorn machine.

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Edmund, who is in his late 30's, is married with two children, one of whom is in school. Since 2007, Edmund has been managing to care for his family by running a general store shop selling different items.  He works from 6:30 AM to 9:30 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his fifteenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Edmund with his previous loans (all of which he paid back successfully) restocked  his general store shop with additional items. With the business profit he received, Edmund bought a music system, radio, TV, and sofa set. Edmund dreams that one day he will be able to build a nice family house. He will use this loan to buy more shop products like dry food items (rice and flour), airtime, and other needed items.

Edmund will share this loan with his loan group "Tanzanite" which totals ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more shop products like dry food items (rice and flour), airtime, and other needed items

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 59-year-old married father of three children who has worked as a security guard for the past 20 years to provide his family with the necessary standards of living.
 
Jamal’s income isn’t enough to cover the additional unexpected family requests. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his son's necessary medications.
 
In the future, Jamal hopes to stay capable of doing his job to make sure that he can support his family’s needs. He also hopes to open his own business after he retires.

loans.use: to pay for his son's necessary medications

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Thelma hopes to find a good stall for her business, and dreams to have a happy family. She meets her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Victoriana has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Victoriana is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

In the future, Victoriana hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is a married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a merchant who sells vegetables to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Flordelisa is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell and to pay the school fees of her children. Through this, she will be able to improve the variety of the vegetables she sells.

In the future, Flordelisa hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the food and school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell and to pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years of age, married, and a mom of three children. She lives happily with her one child and husband in their village. She owns a home-based store for income. She has been running this kind of business for six years. She is thankful because through her husband support and hard work, they are able to increase their profit. 

Now, she still dreams for a continuous smooth flow of her home-based store. To realize her dreams she is requesting additional working capital of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan amount to buy cases of soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, bar soap, and assorted biscuits to stock in her store. 

She hopes and prays for the approval of lenders to her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, bar soap, and assorted biscuits to stock in her store.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra has a variety store, which she has run for more than four years now. She is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items and products. Her loan was also helpful for the education of her children. Her income from the business assisted their household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Petra hopes that her business will grow and expand even bigger and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven children. Yolanda has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Yolanda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. 

Yolanda hopes to make their farming business a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla has operated a clothing sales business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. The previous loan helped her operate her business efficiently and earn an income to support the family.

With the loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred grows crops for subsistence and sells some when the season is good. He also rears cattle to get milk for his family, but also sells some to the dairy when most of his cows are milking. 

He wants money to buy cows, which are now selling cheaply because parents are returning children to university and the need for tuition forces them to sell at low prices. He is optimistic he will be able to get higher returns during the festive season in December. He is hard working.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a 29-year-old Lebanese man who is married and lives with his wife and three children. Since 2008, he has run a business installing and repairing elevators, and has one full-time employee who works under his supervision. He is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy new tools in order to improve his repair services. In the future, he hopes to work on multiple projects as a way to expand his business operations and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy new tools

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old single Lebanese man. He opened his own barbershop in 2010 after gaining seven years experience working for someone else. He has been working since he was quite young, and his main goal is to help his family financially. He is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy new tools. He is very positive about his business prospects and plans to open a new branch of his shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy new tools

loans.name: Karenia

texts.es:
Karenia trabaja  en el área de ventas de una empresa fotográfica. Vive con su tía quien trabaja por cuenta propia. Sus metas futuras son trabajar en su profesión, poder estudiar postgrados e idiomas. Con esto espera realizarse profesionalmente y también lograr su progreso y el bienestar de su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas y se destaca por el gran esfuerzo que pone por sobresalir y ser la mejor.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de su manutención diaria, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Karenia works in the area of sales for a photography company.  She lives with her aunt, who works on her own.  Her future goals are to work in her profession and to be able to do graduate studies and study languages.  With this she hopes to fulfill herself professionally.  She also hopes to manage to make progress and achieve well-being in her family.

She is studying business administration.  She stands out for the great effort she puts into excelling and being the best.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay for her daily subsistence.  This way she will be able to continue studying, and she will be closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay for her daily subsistence.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 56 years old. He lives in Tumauini with his spouse and mother. He is involved in the agricultural business sector, specifically farming. He grows corn on a plot of land. He is very hardworking and the type of person who puts family first, thus doing his best to keep generating a better income from farming. 

With this loan he will purchase sacks of fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. This business, to be financed by the Kiva lenders, will significantly increase his family income and all members will have their living conditions improved.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: As the married mother of four children, Christina works hard to support her family. She has a business selling phone accessories in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by running a general store. She is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy phone accessories to sell to her customers. Christina has sustained her business through three prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and weighing scale

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 34-year-old married woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is hard working woman. For the last sixteen years she has been running an embroidery shop. With her little income she helps her husband to meet the family needs and her son's education costs. She knows a lot about embroidery and as a result her clients always appreciate her work. 

She has requested for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can expand her embroidery shop. Her biggest dream is to move forward so that she can lead a better life with dignity.

loans.use: to expand her embroidery shop.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat, 41 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a grocery store for seven years and his wife works as a cashier. 

Using his previous loan he started a new business of smokeless fuel sales in order to reduce air pollution in Ulaanbaatar. 

He is now requesting a loan of 4500000 MNT to buy a large amount of foodstuffs at wholesale prices. By doing so, he will continue to run his grocery store without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy large amount of foodstuffs for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en: Hovik lives in the Shirak region with his wife and school-age daughter. His wife is an experienced teacher at a local school, and for more than 15 years he has run a printing business and a small bookstore. He prints leaflets, booklets, journals, scientific articles etc. and sells different books, including school textbooks and dictionaries. His small business currently needs some investments to function effectively, and he is requesting a loan for $3,000 to update and expand the assortment of goods he sells in his bookstore as well as buy paper for printing. Hovik and his family are very thankful to all their lenders for their good will and support.

loans.use: to update and expand the assortment of goods he sells in his bookstore and buy printing paper

loans.name: Karoti 1A Group

texts.en:
Fransiscar, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who are in school. For four years now, she has had two different businesses, a beauty salon and a poultry-selling business. She is doing fine with both, works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month. She is requesting her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She paid back her first one successfully, and used it to buy equipment for her salon. Fransiscar used the profit she earned to buy salon furniture, a cupboard for her home and a TV. She will use this loan to buy chicken feed and more beauty salon equipment. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a house and greatly improve her businesses. 

Fransiscar will share this loan with loan group Karoti 1a, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Genara is a married woman and has six children.

Genara has been in this business for more than 10 years now.
 
Genara is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soaps, toiletries, biscuits, snack foods, cooking ingredients and others. 

With this, she will be able to improve her stocks and attracts more buyers, thus augment her sales and income. Genara hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soaps, toiletries, and others.

loans.name: Dora María

texts.es:
Dora de 32 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, de 10 años de edad y estudia 3° grado y 8 años de edad que estudia 1° grado, el menor tiene 2 meses de edad. Dora solo pudo estudiar hasta 5° grado. En casa conviven 4 personas con ella.

En su familia siempre han tenido un negocio en que venden tortillas de Maíz, comenzó su abuela y desde hace diez años lo maneja Dora. Todos los días trabaja de 6 de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, para poder palmear las tortillas venderlas y así tener ingresos para su familia.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de Maíz en grano y Cal hidratada, ambos necesarios para la elaboración de las tortillas que son la principal fuente de ingresos, por venta de la familia. Con ello se asegura la elaboración y con las ganancias espera  darle el servicio medico que necesita su hijo recién nacido.

Espera que sus hijos terminen su estudios y si todo sale como espera, quiere comprar otra plancha para hacer tortillas y  contratar a alguien que le ayude en la venta.
texts.en:
Dora, 32, has a spouse and three children.  Her ten-year-old is in 3rd grade, her 8-year-old is in 1st grade and her youngest is two-months-old.  Dora was only able to complete fifth grade.  Four people live at home with her.

Her family has always had a corn tortilla shop.  It was started by her grandmother and Dora has been running it for ten years.  She works every day from six in the morning until three in the afternoon hand-making tortillas to sell to earn family income.

The loan will be used to buy corn by the kernel and lime powder both of which are needed to make tortillas whose sales are her main source of family income.  With it she will be able to insure production and use profits to provide medical care needed by her new-born son.

She hopes her children will complete their schooling and if everything turns out as expected she hopes to buy another griddle to make tortillas and to hire someone to help her with the sales.

loans.use: to buy tortilla-making ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Roberto Alcides

texts.es:
Roberto de 23 años de edad, es un joven soltero, no tiene hijos y estudia una carrera universitaria, vive con sus padres y un hermano.

Roberto trabaja en la alcaldía de la comunidad, desempeñando el cargo de asistente de contador, todos los dias trabaja de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde, su trabajo queda a 5 minutos en automóvil. Goza de dos días de descanso que los utiliza para ir a clases.

El préstamo sera utilizado para pagar gastos de estudios, en la universidad debe pagar las materias que va a cursar y el préstamo sera usado para eso.

Roberto tiene como meta ser un estudiante destacado, terminar su carrera de la universidad y algún día formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Roberto, 23, is a young single man with no children attending university; he lives with his parents and his brother.

Roberto works for the city as an accounting assistant every day from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon.  His place of work is a five-minute car ride away.  He uses the two days off he gets to attend classes.

The loan will be used to pay university expenses; he must pay tuition for the classes he takes and the loan will be used for that purpose.  His goal is to be an outstanding student, to finish his university career and one day establish a family of his own.

loans.use: to pay tuition costs.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase two bales of clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Valmore De Jesús

texts.es:
Valmore de 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos de 24 años de edad, 26 años de edad, 28 años de edad, 30 años de edad y 33 años de edad, todos independientes y con familia aparte. Su esposa es ama de casa y ademas de ella vive con una nieta.

Desde  pequeño a Valmore le gusto el trabajo agrícola, se iba con su padre a trabajar y fue así que aprendió todo lo que hoy en día sabe. Él solo trabaja la tierra y comenta que se le hace difícil porque ya no es un joven.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo ya establecido y para pagar mano. Espera cosechar buen grano y asegurar el alimento hasta el otro año y si hay posibilidad vender parte de la cosecha a buen precio.
texts.en:
Valmore, 56, is married with five children who are 24, 26, 28, 30 and 33 years of age.  All are independent with families of their own.  His wife’s a housewife and a granddaughter lives with them.

Valmore has worked in agriculture since he was a boy; he’d accompany his father to work and that’s how he learned everything he knows to this day.  He works the land alone and says it’s difficult now because he’s not young anymore.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the crops already planted and to pay labor costs.  He hopes to harvest good grain and insure food for another year and if possible to sell part of the harvest for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Kayra Xiomara

texts.es:
Kayra de 34 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 2 hijos, una de 14 años de edad que estudia 8° grado y uno 2 años de edad. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 5° porque sus padre no podían, con los gastos de estudios ya que tenia 11 hermanos. En casa conviven 4 personas y ambos mantienen a sus dos hijos.

Tiene 5 años de vender pupusas, de pequeña trabajo con una tía que también vendía pupusas, tomo la iniciativa de empezar un pequeño negocio y al ver los buenos resultados se decidió por establecer su negocio, ahora vende también empanadas y pasteles de carne,  todos los días comienza a vender sus productos desde las 4 de la tarde.


El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de ropa, especialmente de mujer, ve un negocio potencial porque todas las personas de la comunidad incluso, ella tiene que ir a la ciudad a comprar sus vestidos. Sera la primera en tener este tipo de negocio en la zona.

 Espera seguir trabajando para darle el estudio completo a su hijos, si todo resulta bien comprara mas  mesas para la pupuseria y así dar mejor servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Kayra, 34 years old, lives in a four-person household with her partner and their two children. One of the children is 14 years old and is in the 8th grade, and one is two years old. She and her partner both work to support their two children. Kayra was only able to attend school until the fifth grade because her parents couldn't afford it, given the school fees and the fact that she had 11 siblings.

Kayra has been selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas] for five years. At a young age, she started working with her aunt who also sold pupusas. Kayra took the initiative to start a small business, and once she began to see results she decided to establish her business. She now sells empanadas and meat pastries as well. She starts to sell her products every day at 4:00 in the afternoon.

Kayra will use this loan to buy clothes, especially women's clothes. She sees room for a potential business because everyone in the community, including her, has to go into the city to buy clothes. Kayra will be the first to have this type of business in the area.

She hopes to keep working to allow her children to get a complete education. If all goes well, she will buy more tables for her pupusa restaurant and give her customers better service in this way.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira de 40 años de edad esta acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, de 5 años de edad, de 10 años de edad y estudia 1° grado, la mayor de 15 años de edad y estudia 5° grado. Elvira solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta 2° año de bachillerato. En casa convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos.

Desde hace 14 años, tiene un negocio en el que vende ropa y zapatos, también vende artículos por catalogo visitando clientes de puerta en puerta, saliendo de su casa a las 5 de la mañana tomando el autobús, visita cantones vecinos y regresa a su casa a las 6 de la tarde. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres que también eran comerciantes.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar mas mercadería (ropa) para ambos sexos y de todas las edades, para ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos y satisfacer la demanda.

El sueño de Elvira, es tener su propia casa, para tener algo que dejarles a sus hijos. También espera comprar mostradores para tener parte de su producto en casa.
texts.en:
Elvira, age 40, is in a relationship.  She has three children, ages 5, 10, and 15.  The ten year old is in first grade and the oldest is in fifth grade.  Elvira only had the chance to go to school up until her second year of high school.  She lives in her house with her life partner and her three children.  

She has had a business of selling clothes and shoes for 14 years.  She also sells items by catalog.  She visits customers by going door to door.  She leaves her house at five in the morning and takes the bus.  She visits cantons and neighbors, and she returns home at six in the evening.  She learned this trade from her parents, who were also merchants.

The loan will be used to buy more merchandise (clothes) for both sexes and all ages.  She will do this in order to offer a greater quantity of products and to satisfy the demand.

Elvira’s dream is to have her own house in order to have something to leave her children.  She also hopes to buy display counters in order to have part of her products at home.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothes) for both sexes and all ages.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.es:
Jean Pierre es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jean Pierre no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Jean Pierre trabaja como obrero constructor en diversas obras de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jean Pierre se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará herramientas y tablas para seguir realizando sus obras, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre, 23, is single living with his parents and siblings in the city of Piura in Jayanca District.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and has a strong self-improvement drive.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to go to work, Jean Pierre has been unable to study a professional Law career.

On his own initiative, Jean Pierre works as a construction worker on various projects in the city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and thinks he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Jean Pierre is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy tools and lumber to continue doing his work.  He will thus continue to work and strive to reach his great dream of studying a professional career.

loans.use: to buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Al Zahraa

texts.en: Al Zahraa is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Her husband works in security and she cooperates with him with the revenue that she earns thanks to her beauty salon, which she opened two years ago.  She only serves woman and she has a fair number of customers visiting her because of her welcoming character. Currently, Al Zahraa is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy beauty products and hairdressing supplies with the aim of providing her clients with top quality services. As for her future plans, Al Zahraa is motivated to expand her work and she will possibly start laser services once she is able to afford the machine’s high cost.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo, tiene 52 años de edad, está casado, tiene cuatro hijos y reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender tortillas. Hace 10 años que se dedica a la venta de nieves(hielo molido con miel y jugo). Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 17,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de un molino para moler hielo. Este préstamo le ayudara a ahorrar  tiempo, ya que le tocaba ir todos los días a moler hielo. Su meta  para el próximo año es compra una máquina para hacer palomitas de maiz.
texts.en:
Pablo, 52, is married with four children and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  He used to work selling tortillas but for the last ten years has been selling ‘nieves’ (ground ice with honey and juice).  He sells from place to place.

The loan he’s requesting is for 17,000 Lempiras that he will use to buy a mill to grind ice.  This loan will help him save time because he’s had to go every day to have the ice ground.  His goal for next year is to buy a popcorn popping machine.

loans.use: to buy an ice grinder.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 58 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor, desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo y venta de café en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos,  ha decidido invertir en sus cultivos y desea comprar fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder tener una muy buena cosecha, obtener mejores ganancias y así poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Francisco is 58 years old and lives with his family in a home of his own.  He is a hardworking, responsible, and enterprising man who has been raising and selling coffee in his area for several years.  He has very good customers since he was able to win his customers’ trust.  He offers quality and good prices in his products.  He has decided to invest in his crops and wants to buy fertilizer, compost, plant disease prevention, etc. so that he can have a good harvest, have better earnings, and be able to continue providing his family with a better quality of life without limit.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 34 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 13  es el único que asiste a la escuela y de 4 años d edad. Carlos solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado debido a dificultades económicas, su comapeñra de vida, es ama de casa, el hijo mayor trabaja la tierra con él. Cinco personas conviven en la casa y todas dependen de Carlos.

Carlos es agricultor desde los 14 años de edad, aprendió a trabajar con su padre a quien acompañaba en los trabajos agrícolas. Hoy en día tiene su propia parcela, camina 30 minutos para llegar a ella y trabaja alrededor de 5 horas diarias.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar fertilizantes, tiene establecido un cultivo de 7,000 mts cuadrados de Maíz y necesita dar la segunda a fertilización para obtener la cosecha esperada.

Espera seguir gozando de salud, para darle el estudio completo a sus hijos y con el tiempo puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old and has a partner. He has three children, who are 17, 13, and four. The only one who goes to school is the thirteen-year-old. Carlos was only able to attend school until the fourth grade due to economic difficulties. His life partner is a homemaker, and their eldest son works in agriculture with Carlos. Carlos supports all five people that live together in their household.

Carlos has been working in agriculture since he was 14 years old. He learned to do this work with his father, whom he accompanied in his work in the fields. Today, Carlos has his own plot of land. He walks 30 minutes to get there and works about five hours a day.

Carlos will use this loan to buy fertilizers. He is growing a plot of corn of 7,000 square meters, and needs to fertilize it for a second time to obtain a good harvest.

Carlos hopes to continue to be in good health, to help his children to get a complete education, and, in time, to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a farmer from the village of Ashotavan in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and her two school-age sons (7 and 13 years old). Susanna, with the help of her husband, is engaged in breeding livestock of cows, sheep, and hens, and also beekeeping. She is also cultivating wheat, beech, potato, cabbage, apple, pear and walnut. Susanna's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is the only source of income for the family. 

As their needs are growing day by day, Susanna needs to enlarge the agribusiness to be able to cover the needs of her family. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge help to the family, enabling them to purchase two calves, five sheep, fuel for agricultural machinery, and some forage for the livestock. 

Susanna and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two calves, five sheep, fuel for agricultural machinery, and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 68 años de edad, está soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes. Hace 6 años inicio con su propio negocio de una pulpería en la cual vende refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, queso, pan, leche, jugos, embutidos, etc. El préstamo que solicita es el séptimo ciclo y es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos para surtir mas la pulpería como granos basicos.refrescos,embutidos,jugos carnes y otros. Con esta inversion va  tener una buena estabilidad en el negocio. Su meta es ayudarse así misma y darse una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 68, is single and has two children; she lives in the municipality of Omoa, Cortes.  She opened her own grocery store six years ago where she sells soft-drinks, packaged snacks, rice, beans, cheese, bread, milk, juice, cured meats, etc. 

The loan she’s requesting is her 7th cycle and it’s for 20,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy more merchandise like basic grains, soft-drinks, cured meats, juice, meats and others to stock her store.  With this investment the store will have good stability.  Her goal is to help herself and provide herself better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to weed his land.

loans.name: Maura Elena

texts.es: Maura de 47 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 11, 14 15 y 22 años. Ella en su condición de mujer separada, genera ingresos mediante una actividad comercial desde hace 1 año, para apoyar el sustento de su hogar. Su negocio, venta de mercancía variada, inició cuando una amiga suya, le propuso artículos, con un precio especial para comercializarlos, construyendo una clientela propia. Maura inició distribuyendo entre sus vecinos más cercanos y amigos, ropa femenina y masculina, además de artículos para el hogar. Poco a poco, ha ido invirtiendo en su negocio con lo que recupera por concepto de ventas, y puerta a puerta distribuye los articulos que su experincia le dice que son los que mas impactan a su clientela; hoy Maura tiene un gran desafío y es la competencia que existe, porque esta ofrece mejores precios en productos similares. Su meta es hacer crecer su clientela y lograr mas efectivas negociaciones con sus proveedores, y esto lo logrará haciendo compras por volúmenes, que le permitan obtener  mejores precios, para trasladarselo a sus compradores. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará edredones, sabanas, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aprovechando que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año, y desde ya, sus clientela empieza a comprar estas mercancias para recibir las navidades y el año nuevo, elegantes y unidos en familia en una sola fiesta de abrazos.
texts.en:
Maura, 47, is mother of four children aged 11, 14, 15 and 22 years.  As a separated woman she has been earning income as a merchant for the last year to support her home.  Her business is selling varied merchandise.  She started when a friend of hers suggested items with special prices to sell and she built up her own clientele.

Maura started off selling women’s and men’s clothing and household items among her closest neighbors and friends.  Little by little she’s been investing in the business and recouping what she spends.  She sells items her experience tells her are the most attractive to customers door to door.  Her present challenge is the large amount of competition that exists offering similar products at better prices.

Her goal is to make her clientele grow and to carry out more effective negotiations with her suppliers which she will be able to accomplish by making volume purchases that will allow her to get better prices to pass on to her buyers.  

This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy comforters, sheets and clothes for women, men and children to take advantage of the approaching end-of-year festivities.  Her customers are already placing orders for merchandise to be ready for Christmas and New Year’s to look elegant and together spend family time enjoying a non-stop feast of hugs.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, sheets and clothes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. Two years ago, he started to work at manufacturing furniture. He has his own shop where he completes his work in a very professional way. He always responds to customers positively by creating their wanted designs. 

Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase equipment needed to keep on working efficiently.  He is certain that the loan will help him increase his profits by a large percentage. In the future, he plans to expand his business into another area.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed in his furniture manufacturing business.

loans.name: José Celestino

texts.es:
José de 34 años de edad, esta acompañado, y tiene 2 hijos, de 5 años de edad y 8 años de edad; solo el hijo mayor estudia. Debido a las condiciones económicas de su tiempo. José solo pudo estudiar hasta 9° grado.
Su compañera de vida es ama de casa, con el conviven 3 personas y todas dependen de él.

José es empleado de la alcaldía de su comunidad desde hace tres años, ademas tiene un molino de nixtamal con el que ofrece sus servicios y es ayudado por su comapñera de vida en la atención a los clientes.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar un repuesto para el molino, necesita que lo reparen para dar un mejor servicio, siendo este el que les genera gran parte de sus ingresos.

En el futuro José quiere comprar otro molino,  así aumentar sus ganancias y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, pero lo que mas desea es que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria y vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old and has a partner. He has two children, a five-year-old and an eight-year-old. Only the older child goes to school. Given the economic conditions when he was a child, José was only able to attend school until the 9th grade. 

José's life partner is a homemaker, and José supports all three people in their household.

José has been working in the mayor's office in his community for three years. He also has a nixtamal [tortilla dough] mill that people pay to use. Carlos' spouse helps him to look after their customers.

José will use this loan to buy a replacement for the mill. It needs to be repaired so that it works better, since the mill generates a large part of his income.

In the future, José wants to buy another mill, so that he can increase his earnings and meet the demand from his customers. However, what he most desires is for his children to graduate from university and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy a replacement mill

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 65 años de edad, comerciante, quien no tiene ningún grado académico.  Desde pequeño se dedica al trabajo.  Él no esta casado ni tiene hijos, vive junto a sus hermanas y sus sobrinos. Trabaja en la frontera como cambiador desde hace 40 años y también es Agricultor.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para utilizarlo para recolectar la cosecha de maíz y para independizarse en el negocio de cambio de monedas, ya que en este momento es empleado.  

A futuro  planea seguir trabajando y hacer crecer el capital,  en el cual desea poner a trabajar personas en su negocio;  ya que quiere generar fuentes de empleo en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Antonio is 65 years old. He is a businessperson with no formal education, who has worked from the time he was very young. Antonio is unmarried, and does not have children. He lives with his sisters and his nieces and nephews. For 40 years, Antonio has worked exchanging currency at the border. He is also a farmer.

Antonio is requesting this loan to pay to harvest his crop of corn, and to start his own currency exchange business. He is currently an employee, and would like to go out on his own.

Antonio plans to continue working to increase his capital, which he hopes to use offer people employment in his business. He says that he wants to bring jobs to his community.

loans.use: pay to harvest his crop of corn and to start his own currency exchange business

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en:
Lusik is a farmer from Getap village of Vayots Dzor region. Her family consists of her husband and her two school-age sons (12 and 13 years old). Lusik works as a cleaner in the village school. She is the only breadwinner of the family. To be able to make ends meet, Lusik also breeds livestock (a cow and hens), and cultivates peach, apple, pear and walnut. 

With all the hard work, Lusik is hardly able to meet the growing needs of her family. She currently needs to enlarge the livestock a bit to cover the basic costs of the family.  A loan of 1,500 will be a big support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase a cow, some forage for the livestock and to make previous credit repayments. 

Lusik and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for helping them collect the needed amount of loan to sustain their lives.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, some forage for the livestock and to make previous credit repayments.

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Shirley Milena

texts.es: Desde sus 18 años, Shirley acompañaba a su madre artesana y comerciante en su negocio, de allí recogió toda la experiencia en el mercado y en el año 1976 emprendió de manera autónoma su propia aventura de negocio,  desarrollando las artes, especialmente la elaboración de artículos de bisutería y comercializando prendas de vestir y calzado; gradualmente su clientela fue creciendo y empezó a viajar a una ciudad frontera muy comercial, para distribuir por encargo toda la mercancía que compraba, entre las cuales estaban los electrodomésticos menores , ropa calzado, accesorios femeninos, perfumería etc. Con este negocio a Shirley le empezó a ir muy bien, pero muy pronto al quedar embarazada y con alto riesgo de perder su hijo, hizo un receso comercial y hoy con su hijo de 5 años de edad, junto a su cónyuge, planean brindarle una educación de calidad, para que triunfe en su vida. Las metas de Shirley son cada vez mayores, ella sueña con tener un almacén en otros municipios y por eso se esmera para lograr ahorros para invertir bien. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   materiales e insumos para elaborar aretes,  collares, adornos de cabeza, pulsos, y además comprar calzado y ropa con la cual sus clientes puedan combinar los accesorios que ella produce. Con su credikiva planea impactar a su clientela, aumentar el número de compradores, e incrementar su volumen de ventas y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su crédito en Kiva.
texts.en:
From the age of 18 on, Shirley would accompany her mother who was a craftswoman and merchant in her business.  She acquired much market experience that way and in 1976 started her own independent arts and crafts business venture.  She specializes in making costume jewelry and selling clothes and shoes.  Gradually her clientele grew and she started to travel to a border city that’s very commercial to sell everything she carried to order.  Among the items were small home appliances, clothes, shoes, women’s accessories, perfumery, etc.

Shirley started to do quite well with this business but when she became pregnant and was in danger of losing her baby she took a break from commerce.  Now that her son is 5-years-old, she and her husband want to provide a quality education for him so that he will succeed in life. Shirley’s goals are greater all the time.  She dreams with having stores in other towns which is why she strives so hard to save money to invest well.  

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy materials  and supplies to make earrings, necklaces, hair decorations, bracelets and also to buy shoes and clothes her customers can wear along with the accessories she makes.  She intends to use her Kiva  loan to impact her clientele and increase the number of buyers and sales which is precisely what will lead to her Kiva loan’s success.

loans.use: to buy crafts supplies, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
Yuldosh is married and has five children. His main source of income is from his farm. He owns a plot of land where he grows wheat and onions and sells them at the local markets from which he earns a small monthly income.

Yuldosh is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He hopes that this loan will help to get a good harvest and to further develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Evangelina

texts.es: María Evangelina, de 52 años de edad habita  junto a su familia la cual está conformada por cuatro personas. María trabaja muy duro para poder colaborar con la economía de su hogar junto a su esposo quien es agricultor y albañil. Ella se dedica a la venta de camarones y pescado fresco y seco,  este negocio lo ha realizado durante mucho tiempo y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su principal patrimonio es su casita la cual es muy humilde pero está muy orgullosa de poseerla y poco a poco la quiere ir mejorando. Ella solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para cambiar las láminas de las paredes que con el tiempo, las lluvias y el sol las ha dañado y es necesario sustituirlas ya que cuando llueve se filtra el agua.  Con el préstamo comprará: láminas galvanizadas, clavos y madera. Espera poder contar con esta ayuda ya que considera que las condiciones de su hogar no aguantarán mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
María Evangelina is 52 years old and lives with her family of four. María works very hard to contribute to her household's expenses, alongside her spouse, who works in agriculture and construction.

María works selling shrimp and fresh and dried fish. She has been running this business for a long time, and it is her main source of income.

María's main asset is her home. It's very humble, but she is very proud of having it and wants to improve it bit by bit. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to replace the wall sheeting, which has become damaged by rain and sun with time. She needs to replace the walls because water now comes in when it rains. With this loan, she will buy galvanized metal sheets, nails and wood. 

She really hopes to get this loan since she doesn't think that the condition of her home will hold up for much longer.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails and wood.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Cuando el esposo de Luz Maria compró su celular, hace 8 años, sus vecinos al ver la funcionalidad de este en la comunicación, empezaron a pedirle el favor de venderle minutos o a pedirlo prestado. Él muy observador y basado en las necesidades del sector, le propuso a Luz Maria, comprar celulares con planes amplios, para ofrecer el servicio. Sus ventas desde el principio fueron muy buenas, pues poco a poco construyó una clientela fija y agregó a su negocio todo tipo de accesorios y servicios asociados a celulares, como carcasas, chips, recargas etc así como tambien dulces, galletas etc.. Hoy  cuenta con un punto fijo en una esquina de su domicilio, donde habita con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos adultos. Los principales clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes que por allí circundan, su meta mas adelante, es aumentar su rentabilidad y tener nuevos puntos de servicio. En la actualidad Luz Maria está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina, nuevas carcasas baterías y celulares, con ello espera incrementar sus entradas de dinero y tener una mayor rentabilidad, lo cual hace exitoso su credikiva.
texts.en:
When Luz María’s husband bought his mobile phone 8 years ago her neighbors saw how functional this was for communications and started to ask to borrow it or to sell them minutes of air time.  Being very observant and noticing the need that existed in the sector, he proposed to Luz María that they buy mobile phones with ample plans to offer this service.  

Their sales were good from the very beginning for she gradually established a regular clientele.  She added all types of mobile phone accessories and associated services like carrying cases, chips, recharges, etc. to her business as well as candy, cookies, etc.

Today, she has a fixed point on the corner by her house where she lives with her husband; they have three adult children.  Her main customers are neighbors and passers-by that frequent the area.  Her goal for later on is to increase profitability and to have new service points.

Luz María at present is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy a display case, new carrying cases, batteries and mobile phones to increase income and profitability which will lead to her Kiva loan’s success.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: Héctor, de 43 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su pequeña hija de 6 años y su esposa. Es un hombre trabajador y muy dedicado a su hogar. Su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de Minutas (postre elaborado con hielo raspado y con toque de jarabe con diferentes sabores), la venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su comunidad. Héctor quiere mejorar las condiciones de su casa ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias el techo y los pilares se han deteriorado, esta es la razón por la cual se presentó a FUSAI para solicitar este pequeño préstamo y así poder comprar lo necesario como láminas galvanizadas, clavos, para reparar el techo y además comprar el cemento, hierro, arena y grava para hacer las columnas de concreto de su vivienda ya que es el único patrimonio que posee para proteger a su familia.
texts.en:
Hector is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their little six-year-old daughter. He is hardworking and very dedicated to his household. 

Hector's main source of income comes from selling "Minutas" (a dessert made from shaved ice and different flavours of syrup). He makes his sales as a street vendor in the different areas of his community. 

Hector wants to improve the condition of his home, since the roof and structural supports have deteriorated with time and due to rain. This is why he requested this small loan from FUSAI, so that he will be able to buy necessary items, like galvanized metal sheets and nails, to repair the roof. In addition, he will buy cement, iron, sand and gravel to make concrete support columns for the house, since it is the only asset with which he can protect his family.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails, cement, iron, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 36-year-old married father of four children who works in painting furniture. He is a Palestinian refugee, living and working in Lebanon with limited access to several working opportunities. Chadi is his family's sole breadwinner, which is why he is a hard worker. He puts much effort into improving his business productivity to attract more customers and increase his income. He has 16 years of experience in this work, which provides him with special talent and customers’ trust.

Chadi is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special paint compressor and a specialized wood cutting machine. These tools will enable him to do his work in a professional way. In the future Chadi hopes to open his own furniture painting shop. Today, he uses others' work locations and pays rent for the space, which is an additional expense he wants to eliminate.

loans.use: to buy a special paint compressor and a specialized wood cutting machine

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 28 years old, from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages three, four, and eight. 

Marisa and her husband are engaged in a transportation business, locally known as, 'habal-habal.' This is in the form of a motorcycle that, sometimes, has extended seats to accommodate more passengers. This is usually the mode of transportation for some of the remote places in the province of Bohol. 

Marisa is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for their motorcycle, like sprockets, oil, tires, and a motor chain.

Marisa hopes that she can continue sending her children to school through the profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy sprockets, oil, tires, and a motor chain.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 36 years old and lives in Compound #3. She is married and has five children between the ages of 19 and 23. Only two of them attend school, and all of them live at home. Sarah only attended school until the 5th grade. 

For the past four years, Sarah has been selling biscuits, eggs, and cold water. She started this business with money that she borrowed from her mother. One problem that she faces is a lack of commodities to sell. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, eggs, and cold water for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to earn more money. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, eggs, and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Frank Adalberto

texts.es:
Frank es un joven  de 21 años de edad, emprendedor y trabajador que se hizo cargo de su mamá y una hermana como hombre del hogar al fallecer su padre, se responsabilizó de su familia, él estudió hasta noveno grado y desde entonces se dedicó junto a su padre al negocio del ganado.

Tiene 5 años de experiencia en el negocio de la compra y venta de ganado y desde hace 2 años que esta solo en el negocio por la muerte de su padre quien fue el que le enseño.

El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de vaquillas para repasto, el cliente quiere aprovechar a comprar ya que el ganado esta barato y además es su primera experiencia con créditos.


A futuro,  Frank quiere que su negocio crezca quiere tener una ganadería grande y comenzar a producir leche para la venta, y además casarse y formar su propia Familia...
texts.en:
Frank is 21 years old and is described as a hard-working young man with an entrepreneurial spirit. He finished the ninth grade before going to work with his father in the livestock business. When his father died two years ago, Frank had to take his place as the person who provides for his mother and sister. Frank’s father taught him the business, and he has five years of experience buying and selling livestock. He has been on his own for two years now.
  
Frank will use this loan to buy cows for breeding. He says that this is his first time borrowing money, and he wants to take advantage of current livestock prices, which are very low. Frank says that he wants to expand his business and have a large cattle ranch to produce milk to sell. He also wants to marry and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy cows for breeding.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is married and has two children.  He is from Dilijan city of Tavush region. To meet the needs of his family, Edik is engaged in breeding livestock (cows and pigs) and in the cultivation of plums, figs, blood oranges, apples, pears, and walnuts. Farming is the only source of income for Edik's family. He sells his agricultural products in the local market. 

As the life gets more expensive, Edik needs to expand his agribusiness to cover the needs of the family more effectively. He is requesting a loan of $3,000, which he will use to purchase two cows and some forage for his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and forage

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Doña Marcos es una mujer de 36 años de edad casada con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante al lado de su esposo y de sus 4 hijos los cuales estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y en familia se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de aves de corral. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo por lo cual agradece a DIOS por haberle dado la oportunidad de estudiar la primaria completa y tener un conocimiento del estudio. Ella no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ya que ellos eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarle. Uno de sus más grandes deseos y sueños es que su casa de habitación tenga iluminación por lo que en la comunidad donde ella vive la luz eléctrica no es posible su instalación por los momentos, esto dificulta muchas cosas en su familia ya que sus hijos estudian y apoyan a sus padres pero al momento de elaborar sus tareas se les dificulta por lo que ellos lo hacen con iluminación de candil o vela comercial. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de un panel solar el cual le ayudara con los quehaceres del hogar y evitara que el gasto en la compra de materia (madera para fogata o candil de ocote) para poder tener luz en su casa y a sus hijos en sus estudios. Su meta es que mediante la compra de este producto ella podrá mejorar su vivienda previniendo un incendio, humo en su hogar que pueda causar daño a sus hijos mismos que además podrán aprovechar un poco más las horas de la noche para hacer sus tareas.
texts.en:
Marcos, 36, is married and very much wants to make improvements and get ahead alongside her husband and four children who attend the local school.  The entire family works in agriculture and raising barnyard fowl.  

She completed elementary school and thanks God for having given her the opportunity to complete elementary school and for having learned from school.  She was unable to continue because of the lack of economic support from her parents because they had limited resources and were unable to support her.  

One of her greatest wishes and dreams is to have electricity at home because the community she lives in doesn’t have electricity and its installation is impossible at present.  This makes many things difficult for her family.  Although her children attend school and help out their parents, at the moment doing homework is difficult for they do it by candle light or kerosene lamp.

She’s currently asking for help to buy a solar panel that will help with daily chores and save on costs of materials (firewood or pitch pine) to have illumination at home for her children’s studies.  Her goal is that by means of this purchase she will improve her home avoiding fires and smoke at home that can damage her children and they will be able to take advantage of more hours at night to do their homework.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her house.

loans.name: Blanca Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de variedad de productos, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra  de  material de construcción para la refacción de su departamento,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como sabanas al por mayor,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Blanca continues with her same activity selling various products.  She relates that she did well with her previous loan that she used to buy building supplies to improve her apartment.  On this occasion, she requests the loan to buy merchandise like sheets at wholesale.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to grow in business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 26 años de edad para y para poder tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de manutención trabaja en su pequeño negocio como ganadero, Jorge cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y le gusta su trabajo.

Jorge está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para colocar piso de concreto en el pequeño cuarto donde vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Jorge is 26 years old and runs a small livestock business in order to generate an income with which to pay his expenses.  Jorge believes that things are going well for him because he is very responsible and likes his work.

Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy building materials to install a concrete floor in the small room where he, his wife and young son live.  In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality, “To provide a good education for his children.”

loans.use: to install a concrete floor in his home.

loans.name: Karla Guadalupe

texts.es:
Karla de 22 años de edad, vive con su pequeño hijo (7 meses); ella no trabaja, únicamente se dedica al cuido de su Bebé. Ella costea sus gastos con la remesa que le envía su esposo de USA. El esposo se dedica a trabajar en construcción. Ella vive con su abuela y 2 hermanos en habitaciones separados.

El crédito se utilizara para construir  una habitación,  en donde dormirá la señora con su Bebé. La idea es tener mayor comodidad y privacidad; además que reúna las condiciones de seguridad y salubridad.


Sobre sus planes a futuro, considera darle una buena crianza a su hijo y con ello se refiere a que no le falte nada para su educación y crecimiento. A medida pase el tiempo y con la ayuda de FUNDACION CAMPO, planea poco a poco a mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karla, 22, lives with her 7-month-old baby boy.  She’s unemployed and currently cares for her baby only.  She covers expenses with a stipend her husband sends her from the United States.  Her husband works in construction and she lives with her grandmother and two siblings in separate bedrooms.

The loan will be used to build a bedroom for her and her baby to sleep in.  The idea is to have more comfort and privacy as well as to have required safety and health conditions.

Her future plan is to raise her son well which means that he lacks nothing for his education and growth.  As time passes and with help from Fundación Campo she plans to gradually make home improvements.

loans.use: to build a bedroom for her and her baby.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and weighing scale

loans.name: Amon

texts.ru: Амон добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый человек. Местность, где живёт Амон, является отдалённым регионом, то есть жители этого села, раз за полгода приезжают в город за продуктами питания, в зимнее время нет доступа к этому селу. В основном Амон и его односельчане занимаются выращиванием картошки. После распада СССР Амон уехал в Российскую Федерацию. Сам Амон перенес много трудности жизни. Так как Амон в детстве не обучался и не имеет никакой профессии,  в России тоже сталкивался со многими трудностями. Когда он находился в России, его жена осталась с малолетними детьми и занималась выращиванием картошки. Амон с целью обучения сына приложил много усилий и устроил сына на частную школу. Его сын Шамсулло обучался в частной школе и несколько раз получил похвальные листы со стороны администрации школы. Амон надеясь на будущее сына после окончания школы отвёз собой в Россию сына. Шамсулло поступил в Красноярский государственный медицинский университет имени профессора Войно-Ясенецского на лечебный факультет. Отец очень рад за успехи сына и обратился в ИМОН за займом с целью оплаты учёбы сына. Он надеется на Ваше благородство и милосердие.
